Job Description:
Job Summary
Senior IT Technician
Chailey Heritage Foundation is seeking to recruit a senior technician working within a small niche team, responsible for supporting the organisation in delivering its strategic objectives through the appropriate provision of information and communication technologies.
The Senior IT Technician will supervise the organisational information and communication technology infrastructure and to deliver a customer focussed and responsive support service for the whole Foundation. They will also be responsible for line managing the Junior IT Technician and IT apprentice.
Working at Chailey Heritage Foundation isn’t like working anywhere else. We are a nationally recognised School and Residential home for children and young adults with complex neuro disabilities. The Senior IT Technician at Chailey will also assist with the maintenance of specialised equipment, some created by our own team, to support the lives of the people we care for.
Due to the nature of the role the following qualification are considered essential:
Minimum CompTIA A+ or similar. Ideally CompTIA N+, CompTIA Security+ & Cloud+
City & Guilds ICT Systems and Principles (NVQ ICT Level 4 equivalent).
Please read the attached JD for full role responsibilities.
Why join us?
Competitive rates of pay starting at £25,375 p.a. (£13.19 per hour)
Pension scheme
Generous holiday entitlement
Full Time hours are 37 hours per week Monday-Friday 52 weeks per year with additional out of hours work when needed.
Comprehensive benefits package
Strictly No Agencies
Chailey Heritage Foundation is committed to safeguarding and promoting the welfare of children and young adults; as such an enhanced DBS disclosure is required.
Chailey Heritage Foundation is an equal opportunities employer and is committed to promoting diversity and inclusion for all its young people and staff. We welcome applications from all sections of the community.
As part of our recruitment process, Chailey Heritage Foundation (CHF) collects and processes personal data relating to job applicants. CHF is committed to being transparent about how it collects and uses that data to meet its obligations under GDPR. Please ensure you have reviewed our privacy policy prior to completing an application with us.

We are looking for a 1st Line IT Support Technician in our growing, transformational charity.

Key responsibilities:
1st line technical ICT support to staff via phone, email and Microsoft Teams
ownership of customer technical issues through to resolution, escalating where needed.
hardware builds, including PC’s, desktops, tablets, phones etc.
technical advice for the ongoing improvements of the Fundraising, HR/Payroll, Operations and Finance systems.
Update systems and servers, apply patches, test systems and liaise with support partners accordingly.
Aid administration of ICT Systems: Internet, Email, Telecoms, Microsoft Office, antivirus/spam software and web filtering.

Are you a 1st Line Service Support Analyst - Service Desk Analyst - 1st Line Desktop Support – 1st Line IT Technician who has the following experience:

Using remote desktop applications to provide support
Minimum 6 months’ experience of IT support in a relevant environment
Providing advice to key users on ICT and systems issues
Willingness to travel
Full clean driving licence

FitzRoy is a national charity that supports people with learning disabilities to develop life skills & achieve their potential. If you are customer-focussed with the ability to research an IT problem and implement solutions, we can offer a stable, permanent role on a full-time basis at our central offices in Petersfield, Hampshire. Join us and be a part of our ambitious digital transformation strategy!

What we can offer in return:
Secure, permanent role
A friendly, flexible environment
25 days holiday (+ bank holidays) rising with service
Pension

We anticipate a large volume of interest in this post, and reserve the right to close this vacancy early should we find the right candidate.

No agencies please

Company introduction
Southern Solutions was founded in 2008. We are a friendly dynamic team focusing on customer satisfaction and completing jobs to the highest standard. We focus on working closely with customers across a wide range of industries to provide the highest level of support. Our support is focused at the small to medium business market providing a completely managed service to companies across the south. Flexibility in how we work allows us to support a wide range of customers in many different sectors. We are passionate about personal and professional development and will support any successful candidate in the progression of their career through training and hands-on experience.
The IT Support Technician role
As an IT Support Technician, you will be joining the company’s expanding support department, supporting clients as a member of their outsourced IT department. You will work closely with the team and customers in a varied role, maintaining the company’s excellent customer service, and presenting a friendly, approachable point of contact for all their IT needs.
In the role you will be required to:
Be involved in the day to day running and management of the helpdesk
Create and resolve IT support tickets for customers
Resolve issues with broadband and leased lines
Resolve 2nd, moving to 3rd line IT support requests
Resolve 2nd, moving to 3rd line server related issues
Maintain a high level of customer satisfaction
Perform maintenance tasks for servers and workstations remotely
Visit site to resolve issues adhering to customers SLA
Visit site to perform planned upgrades/migrations
For site visits a van will be provided
Essential experience / skills required:
Minimum of three years’ experience within a similar IT Support role, preferably supporting SME’s
Infrastructure diagnosis
Microsoft 365 support and deployment
Microsoft Windows Server (2016, 2019)
Microsoft Azure environments
Hardware troubleshooting
Advanced router/firewall configuration
2nd -3rd line support
Desirable experience / skills
Windows Server installation/migration
Microsoft 365 migration
Advanced knowledge of DrayTek and WatchGuard firewalls
Experience working with SQL servers
MCP/MCTS qualifications
3rd line support
What do you need to be successful in this IT Support Technician role
The successful candidate must have a good amount of experience in a similar role, be presentable, punctual, and possess excellent communication/organisational skills. The candidate should also show a real interest in IT and a desire to progress and build upon their current skill set. You will need to absorb yourself in new technologies and continuous development within this role. This is an opportunity to become a key member of a small team within which you will be able to expand your knowledge, experience, and progress your career. Training is key to understanding new technologies, courses will be offered based on candidate skill set.
Benefits
Competitive salary
Training
Company events
You must be eligible to work in the UK.
Reference ID: SS02618
Job Types: Full-time, Permanent
Schedule:
Monday to Friday
Experience:
IT Support: 3 years (Required)
Education:
GCSE or equivalent (Preferred)
Work remotely:
No

JSPC Computer Services are looking for a Full Time IT Technician. The role consists of on-site and office based work. You will be dealing visits to resolve issues on desktops and servers. We are looking for someone to work with our business clients that range from 1 user to 200 users.
You will also be working on the helpdesk within the main HQ of JSPC that is in Sompting. This will involve telephone, email, remote and face to face support. You will also be involved in supporting the general infrastructures of our clients.
Please only apply if you are confident in all the following: -
Skills Required: -
Advising Customers of their needs
Maintain a reliable and secure network including the network hardware; firewalls, switches, routers etc., and the DNS, DHCP and associated services.
Manage HyperV environment, maintaining several Windows 2012-2019.
Active Directory, Microsoft 365 and Azure administration.
Support users by trouble shooting hardware and software issues
PC Diagnostics & Fix
The Job comes with many benefits including: -
Company Vehicle
Mobile Phone
An excellent Team to support one another
Pension Scheme
Health Insurance
A DBS Check will be carried out due to the nature of our clients. A driving licence is required.
The successful candidate should be able to demonstrate: -
People management skills, of both direct and indirect reports
Strong communication, planning and organisational skills
Evidence of being a highly motivational team leader with exceptional team building capabilities
Ability to influence at all levels
Strong customer focus
Proven and strong record in 2nd line IT Support environment
Support and extensive trouble shooting ability
Salary Negotiable
Job Types: Full-time, Permanent
Salary: From £25,000.00 per year
Benefits:
Company Car
Company Events
Company Pension
On-site Parking
Private Medical Insurance
Schedule:
Monday to Friday
Experience:

ASM Truck Diagnostics Ltd is a family run independent workshop based in Grays, Essex, we deliver preventative maintenance, routine servicing, responsive call outs and repairs on all makes of trucks/trailers and commercial vehicles to private sector markets, local authorities and our own hire fleet vehicles. We are looking for an established HGV Technician with Class 1 Licence to work Monday to Friday, alternate Saturdays. Working closely with an established team in order to create high levels of morale and focus to ensure that work is completed in a timely manner and with excellence in quality. Effective communication with the Workshop Manager and team to ensure that you have valid job specifications and time budget prior to work commencing. Ensuring that customer expectations are managed at all times.
Position available with immediate start.
Benefits
· £17 per hour
· Plenty of overtime available if you want it
· Monday to Fri 07:00 to 16:00 hrs, Alternate Saturdays 07:00-12:00 hrs
· Service Van & Fuel provided
· Mobile phone and IPAD
Role and Responsibilities
In order for to be successful in this role, you will work well as part of a small team, be a good communicator and have the ability to take on a variety of different workloads, planned or otherwise.
Working unsupervised to a high standard carrying out –
· Diagnosis and repair of vehicles with a "right first time" attitude
· Carrying out pre-MOT inspections to a high standard
· Servicing of vehicles to a high standard
· Ability to use diagnostic equipment
· Carry out scheduled safety inspections and report any rectifications required
· Attend customer sites and carryout work as required
· Complete electronic job cards, timesheets clearly and accurately
Skills and Experience
· 10+ Years’ experience
· NVQ3 Vehicle Technician industry recognized qualification and served an apprenticeship
· Good understanding of H&S
· Clean Driving Licence - HGV Class 1
Job Types: Full-time, Permanent
Salary: Up to £17.00 per hour
Benefits:
Company car
Company pension
Free or subsidised travel
On-site parking
Schedule:
Day shift
Holidays
Monday to Friday
Overtime
Weekends
COVID-19 considerations:
Masks provided for close contact working. Social distancing adhered to at all times, hand sanitizer stations provided.
Experience:
Commercial vehicle: 10 years (Preferred)
Flexible Working Options Available:
Not offered

Preparation Technician\MOT Tester Car Store Exeter
Our aim is to bring back the excitement in buying a car – it should be one of the best experiences in life and we want to keep it that way. Car Store makes the car-buying occasion fun from start to finish. We don’t call ourselves ‘staff’, we’re a crew and we are all ambitious and energetic.
The role of the preparation technician\MOT Tester is a key productive role in Car Store. Working as part of the workshop team you will be central to the preparation process ensuring that cars are mechanically inspected, MOT tested and repaired on a daily basis in line with Car Stores preparation standards.
Whatever your background or experience level, if you’re an automotive technical guru, you could be the Retail Vehicle Technician we’re looking for. Whether you’re newly qualified, semi-skilled, and MOT tester or even a master technician/ mechanic, from a prestige, volume franchised or independent garage, as long as you’re dedicated to providing the best possible service getting your hands dirty, you’ll fit right in.
Duties of a Preparation Technician\MOT Tester;
Mechanical\cosmetic inspection of vehicles to Car Store preparation standards
Recording health checks on Tech+ App utilising tablet computer
Clocking on and off jobs utilising Tech+ App using tablet computer
Utilising Autodata to investigate correct repair methods
Fitment of parts to cars
Servicing of cars
Communication with production leader to ensure that quality repairs are carried out on all vehicles
Carrying out MOT tests on vehicles as required
Skills and Experience required to be a Preparation Technician\MOT Tester;
Qualified MOT tester
Strong technical background with experience of working as motor vehicle mechanic in similar role
Good communication skills
Ability to carry out repairs efficiently and to a high level of quality
At Car Store we also offer a competitive salary, an awesome environment to work in, as well as the option to treat yourself thanks to our exclusive Crew offers – from high street discounts to new car deals, you’ll be lucky enough to access it all! Sound like your bag? Apply today.
Job Type: Full-time
Additional pay:
Bonus scheme
Schedule:
Day shift
Licence:
MOT (Required)
Driving Licence (Required)

“Our cars are so advanced, you can practically have a conversation with them. #ilovesmarttechnology”
From voice control features that let you tell your car to play music or make a phone call, to the most advanced EcoBoost engine technology, Ford vehicles are a Technician’s dream, you’ll have the chance to drive the standard in customer care that’s because you’re as smart as the technology you’ll be working with, and leave no stone unturned to get the job done for the customer in double-quick time and to the highest standards.
We are looking for a Master Technician to join the Aftersales Team.
You will have the attitude to make it happen and scrupulous attention to detail, you’ll enjoy lots of rewards, from a performance-related bonus, to 33 days’ holiday and ongoing training to keep you up to speed with the latest technical developments. To join us, you’ll need an NVQ 3, City & Guilds or equivalent and Service Technician experience as a minimum. Ideally, you’ll also have an MOT testing qualification and some main dealership experience. You’ll definitely have the smarts.
So what do we look for from you?
An NVQ 3, City & Guilds or equivalent,
Service Technician experience and main dealership experience
An MOT testing qualification is desirable but this isn’t essential.
A full valid driving licence as a minimum
What is vital is that you have the attention to detail to keep standards sky high, and the team spirit that will see you working closely with everyone from the workshop controller and parts department to your fellow technicians.
Please note previous Automotive Technician experience is required for this position.
In addition to receiving a competitive salary, for the right candidate this position will offer:
Industry leading package
33 days annual leave (including bank holidays) in addition to an annual leave purchase & sale scheme
Pension Scheme & Life Assurance
Ford Privilege vehicle purchase scheme
Discount on Service, Bodyshop and Parts
1 day each year to volunteer for a charity of your choice
Cycle to work purchase scheme
Access to Perks at Work discount website
AN AMAZING OPPORTUNITY WITH ONE OF THE TOP 25 SUNDAY TIMES BEST BIG COMPANIES TO WORK FOR
When completing your application please give specific detail of your experience, skills and previous responsibilities that you believe would be relevant to the role you are applying for.
TrustFord is an equal opportunities employer and does not discriminate on any grounds other than ability to carry out the job role.
Should you wish to discuss this position in more detail please email recruitment@trustford.co.uk with your contact details and we will arrange for the recruiting Manager to contact you directly.
We advertise our vacancies to attract candidates and not agency suppliers. If we need agency assistance then we will contact agencies from our Preferred Supplier List. Any speculative CVs we receive will not be accepted as an introduction.

Our Senior Technicians work hard to maintain, diagnose and service some of the most sought-after brands and vehicles in the industry, and it's down to their expertise and knowledge that keeps our customers satisfied and loyal to the Jardine Motors Group. You'll be working in a state of the art, fully equipped workshop, with access to constant training and development in partnership with our manufacturers.
More than 40 years of passion, hard work and innovation has seen Jardine Motors Group grow from a family-run vehicle dealer operation to one of the largest car dealer groups in the UK. Jardine Motors Group represents 16 luxury and premium manufacturers including Audi, Porsche, BMW, Mercedes and Ferrari in over 60 locations across the UK.
We have a clear strategic focus to deliver an unparalleled level of service for every customer; our competitive edge relies on the quality of the people recruited into our teams. With people at the core of our strategy we are discerning about whom we employ, and expect our employees to have high levels of integrity, be passionate about their role and take ownership of their customers’ and colleagues needs in line with our values.
Duties, Responsibilities & Person Specification
To perform all work assigned in a timely manner, economically and to Company and Manufacturer’s standards
To advise Workshop Supervisor if additional work is required on a vehicle and seek their assistance and authority in the rectification of faults
To maintain a high level of competence for the work to be undertaken by undergoing on-site training, attending courses at suppliers and manufacturer’s and reading technical bulletins as required
To discuss with customers, problems with the vehicle as requested (Total Involvement).
To ensure the Company image of professionalism and quality of service is maintained when dealing with customers
To operate equipment and carry out all duties in a safe manner.
To maintain equipment, protective clothing and work areas in a clean, tidy and safe condition
To assist management with the introduction of new methods of work designed to improve efficiency
To carry out any other duties as required
Relevant Experience & Qualifications Required:
NVQ Level 3 qualified or equivalent.
Previous experience within a main dealer is desirable although not essential.
Why us?
As part of our mission to the best motor retailer as judged by you, we believe in offering a collaborative and innovative environment, removed of bias or stereotypes. We want everyone to feel comfortable to be themselves while at work, knowing they will be fully supported in their personal development to be the best they can. In creating an inclusive culture, we respect and celebrate the uniqueness of our colleagues through our #WeAreJMG diversification and inclusion strategy.
To find out more, visit the website here: https://www.jardinemotors.co.uk/corporate/diversityandinclusion/
So, if you’re a Technician with NVQ Level 3 in motor vehicle maintenance (or comparable) and would love to join a successful and dedicated team, then we would love to hear from you.
Here are just some of the extensive benefits you’ll receive:
- 33 days of annual leave (including bank holidays)
- Enhanced parental leave options with up to 16 weeks of full pay.
- Employee care helpline and access to digital GP (for repeat prescription orders and online doctor’s appointments).
- Online discount portal including money off retail brands and cashback on purchases.
- 3% contribution pension scheme and 2x annual salary life assurance
Be able to comply with all company and manufacturer’s disciplines and procedures
TECH_AOL

Job Title: Bodyshop MET Technician VW & BMW Qualified Advantageous
Job Description:
Lovells Auto Body Centre (Structural Repair Centre) is recruiting skilled and talented strip and refit technicians we are especially interested in recruiting qualified BMW, Mini or VW Group Service Technicians who are looking for a new and rewarding challenge in order to take their career on to the next level, we are especially interested in recruiting VW Group and BMW Mini Trained & Qualified Accident Repair Technicians.
We are also keen to talk to potential employees who hold other manufacturer approvals or service department manufacturer qualifications, we are not limited to the ones listed.
Should you be successful in securing employment at Lovells Auto Body Centre you will be working within a team of accident repair professionals within the regions only dedicated main stream structural accident repair centre.
This fully refurbished facility in Fengate Peterborough is currently working toward some high level manufacturer approvals and there will be lots of training and development opportunities during early 2021
Join a focused and forward thinking accident repair business and be part of a winning team, earn an outstanding salary, Skilled and Qualified to the levels described and you will receive a basic hourly rate of £14.50 this could increase if you hold multiple qualifications and supporting qualifications such as F Gas, ADAS, Bonded Glass, Bonding and Riveting Hybrid Technician holding these qualifications increase your earning potential, all qualifications need to be current and in date.
You will be working 2002 hours per year over an average of 3.5 days a week, there is also an agreed amount of contracted overtime.
Holiday We offer an unrivalled holiday package, that equates to 6 weeks paid holiday each year and on top of this we pay all statutory Bank Holidays that equates to a total of 37 days paid holiday.
Discounted Home Insurance and Car Insurance (for you plus one other at the same address)
At Lovells Auto Body Centre you are offered a 70% discount off of your insurance premiums after your NCD has been applied, this is if you insure through our selected insurance broker partner Gauntlet Insurance, this is for car, home & Contents Insurance, we offer a 50% discount for a second policy at the same address and a 30% discount on a second home policy while in our employment.
Sage Benefits
Employment with our company offers you membership of the Sage Payroll benefits scheme, this delivers meaningful savings on home shopping, holidays, flights, entertainment, mobile phone contracts, plus much much more.
Employment at Lovells will enable you to take control of your career, its not just another job, if you have the right attitude and you are motivated by the opportunity to develop your skills we will open doors to industry leading training and enroll you on the finest Vehicle Manufacturer Training Programs
We are specialising in Electric and Hybrid Vehicle repairs therefore we are recruiting people who thrive on technology advancements people who want to be leaders in a fast paced industry.
Apply today upload your CV and we will be in touch, we will arrange a first informal interview this can be done in the evenings or at weekends if this suits you better, our total discretion is assured
This is a opportunity to take your career to another level, work in an accident repair business that is investing for the next generation of vehicle repairs and the capability to deal with all the latest and future technology, this facility is a place where careers developed and people achieve the high earner status in vehicle accident repair.
We have opportunities for Trained Experienced and Qualified Accident Repair Professionals
Lovells Auto Body Structural Centre recruiting the following
Panel Beaters, Skilled, Talented, Motivated Professionals who hold a minimum on a Senior ATA - ( if you are trained and qualified to BMW, Mini, VW or Audi standards, the holder of in date certificates we will offer an uplifted hourly rate over £14.50 starting rate
Paint Sprayers, Skilled & Motivated with an excellent attitude and a focused team player, qualified to Senior ATA we are especially interested if you are BMW Colour System Qualified this will enable you to earn a salary uplift over the £14.50 starting rate
MET Strip and Refit Technicians Senior ATA, though we are especially interested in talking to you if you are BMW, Mini, VW, Audi, Skoda, Seat or VW Commercial, either Bodyshop or Dealership Manufacturer Qualified, if you hold current in date qualifications your base starting rate will be up lifted above £14.50
We are also recruiting team members who are improvers NVQ2 or NVQ3 qualified or those who are not qualified, providing you are motivated with an excellent attitude we will train you to ensure you achieve the top level with a salary package to match.
Some things not to be forgotten
Here is a overview of the Benefits of working at Lovells Auto Body Centre
Senior ATA Qualified offers a starting rate of £14.50 per hour - our rewards program that can take you to £23.10 per hour
You will work only an average of a 3.5 days a week
Fully Funded Manufacturer Training to the highest level delivered by BMW, Mini, VW Audi Skoda Seat VW Commercial & the IMI
6 Weeks Paid Holiday plus all Bank Holidays are paid.
Holiday Buy Back Scheme if you don't take the 6 weeks holiday you can sell them back to us for full price.
70% Car Insurance Discount
50% House Insurance Discount
Sage Salary Discount Membership Scheme
Contracted 189 hours Overtime Per Year

Ideally, you’ll also have an MOT testing qualification and some main dealership experience. You’ll definitely have the smarts.
So what do we look for from you?
An NVQ 3, City & Guilds or equivalent,
Service Technician experience and ideally, you’ll also have some main dealership experience
An MOT testing qualification is desirable but this isn’t essential.
A full valid manual driving licence held for a minimum period of 6 months
What is vital is that you have the attention to detail to keep standards sky high, and the team spirit that will see you working closely with everyone from the workshop controller and parts department to your fellow technicians.
Please note previous Automotive Technician experience is required for this position.
In addition to receiving a competitive salary, for the right candidate this position will offer:
Industry leading package bonus scheme with uncapped earnings
33 days annual leave (including bank holidays) in addition to an annual leave purchase & sale scheme
Pension Scheme & Life Assurance
Ford Privilege vehicle purchase scheme
Discount on Service, Bodyshop and Parts
1 day each year to volunteer for a charity of your choice
Cycle to work purchase scheme
Access to Perks at Work discount website

Job Title: In-House Facilities / Maintenance Technician
Target Start Date: As soon as possible
Contract Type: Full-Time
Salary Range: £21 850 inclusive of Shift allowance + On Call allowance
Location: Bournemouth
In-House Facilities / Maintenance Technician : A new opportunity has become available to join our expanding Facilities department as an In-House Facilities / Maintenance Technician . Ageas is an Insurance company with two large buildings, occupying 800 + employees. Your key responsibility will be to support and maintain the site, working as part of a team. You will provide operational support to ensure the highest standards are upheld and delivered in the business.
Reporting to the Facilities Team Leader, the In-House Facilities / Maintenance Technician will play a crucial role as they will be responsible for ensuring that building functions, facilities and vehicles remain compliant at all times whilst delivering services to customers at all levels across the business.

Flexibility is a must for this role as the In-House Facilities / Maintenance Technician will be required to work on a rotational shift pattern and on call out-of-hours on a rota basis to respond to any emergencies to ensure continuous cover to the business. Therefore, it is important that the right candidate lives in close proximity to the office, i.e, 30 minutes' drive, to be able to respond quickly and efficiently to emergencies.

The ideal In-House Facilities / Maintenance Technician must have trades experience and be skilled in carrying out maintenance tasks over a wide spectrum ideally;- plumbing, carpentry, carpet laying, painting & decorating and specialist cleaning, control as required as well as an understanding of buildings heating, cooling and ventilation requirements and an ability to track faults or equipment failure.
A positive and flexible attitude, coupled with strong interpersonal and communication skills is a must.

Main Responsibilities as In-House Facilities / Maintenance Technician:
Delivering required planned preventative maintenance and undertaking first-line repairs as required.
The jobholder will conduct periodic inspection of work equipment and maintain an asset log (WASP System) for audit and reporting
You will manage external contractors to ensure they deliver their services successfully in compliance with the law, regulation and the Company's Health & Safety
processes.
You will implement Personal & Premises Team Health and Safety initiatives; safety rules for Contractors, workplace Health, Safety and Welfare Regulations, Control of
Substances Hazardous to Health.
You will support physical security arrangements by ensuring that buildings are correctly secured out of hours and intruder alarms are set.
You will be a key member of the Facilities Business Continuity Management Team (BCM) and required to be on-call.
Skills and experience you need as In-House Facilities / Maintenance Technician:
Knowledge & Skills: Skilled to carry out maintenance tasks over a wide spectrum including plumbing, carpentry, carpet laying, painting & decorating and specialist cleaning jobs.
Must be physically able to handle heavy furniture and equipment for which full manual handling training will be given.
An appreciation of current Health and Safety law and regulation applicable to areas within their responsibility acquired through Safe Systems of Work.
Minimum of two years trades experience.
PC Skills: Ability to use MS Office for Emails and Calendars, Excel, Word.
Communication Good communication skills, both written and verbal
Managing Self; flexibility to adopt appropriate behaviour given the situation, acts with integrity, openness and honesty, positive, enthusiastic and energised.
Building relationships: To be supportive of other team members and foster good working relationships internally and externally.
A full driving licence is required.
Here are some of the benefits you can enjoy within the In-House Facilities / Maintenance Technician role based in Bournemouth:
A competitive pension for which Ageas will pay twice the amount.
Generous amount of holidays with the option to buy up to 10 additional days.
Annual Salary review.
Discretionary annual bonus based on personal and company performance.
Life assurance of 4 x salary with the option to flex up.
Return to work programme scheme.
Flexible benefits package (private medical insurance, health and dental plans, free life assurance policy, discounted gym membership, cycle to work scheme as well as discounts with a wide range of retailers through our partner Perkz.com).
Support groups- well-being activities, yoga, mindfulness sessions, Sports and Social Club events and more.
Ageas are a leading provider of award-winning insurance solutions in the UK. Our people help us create a thriving, creative and innovative place to work and our purpose is clear, to make insurance easy and personal for our customers.
To find out more about #Ageas visit our careers page www.ageas.co.uk/careers
Click on the 'Apply button' to be considered for our In-House Facilities / Maintenance Technician opportunity at Ageas in Bournemouth.
#INDHP2

Job Description
Are you a Vehicle/Diagnostic Technician?
Looking for a change?
Are you looking to play an important role within the company? Do you have a strong work ethic, take pride in your work and have the ability to work well under pressure?
If so, please read on.
We have a fantastic opportunity that has arisen for a vehicle/diagnostic technician to join our fantastic team here at D & D Autos.
D&D Autos is an award winning family run business, that has been established for 35 years. Today D&D Autos operates a 15 bay purpose built vehicle garage located on Orbital park in Ashford Kent. It is a busy garage with a large customer base, which is still growing due to our fantastic reputation.
D&D Autos is an independent garage that has achieved garage of the year and excellent customers service in multiple awards over the years. We are a Bosch Car Service Centre, operating with the latest technology and training.
We have a fantastic competent team at D&D Autos with a mix of skills and age groups from senior technicians with many years’ experience to younger technicians well versed in modern motoring. We are confident in tackling all types of servicing and repairs and are supported with an excellent experienced front of house service team.
Here at D&D Autos being efficient is important, but getting the job done correctly for the benefit of the customer is the priority. We know that well looked after, motivated Technicians are essential to providing a great customer experience. Therefore, you will receive the same level of care as our valued customers with great pay and a holiday package.
Description of the role includes wanting to be the best technician you can be, repairing and maintaining vehicles to manufactures specifications and being able to problem solve effectively, whilst being committed to working to a high standard to maintain a great customer service.
Qualifications required include NVQ Level 3 or equivalent and a minimum of 5 years experience.
We like our technicians to look forward and prepare for the future with us as a team. We always prepare to keep abreast of technology including hybrid and diagnostic techniques, using the latest technologies, whilst working with up to date equipment. Here at D & D’s we want to progress your career.
If this sounds like you then email your CV to arrange a time to have a chat about this exciting position.
Kind Regards
Matthew Pestridge.
Director
01233 504765
www.ddautosashford.co.uk

Salary: £26,000.00 to £35,000.00 /year
Job Type: Full-time
Salary: £28,000.00-£35,000.00 per year

NVQ Level 3 (Preferred)
Location: Ashford, Kent, South East England, England

Job Title: Hidden sector - field technician and incident supervisor
Job Description:
Due to further expansion of our service area we are recruiting again. Richfords Fire and Flood are in the business of Giving You Your Life Back, after unexpected property damage such as fires and floods. We are a values based organisation. As important as the skills you bring, is that your values closely match our values.
This is an immersive role for a capable person.
You are in the front line of our service - it would be you that meets the customer at their time of need - the person who takes practical steps to start to give them their lives back
You will be arrive in a Transit size vehicle which will be fully equipped with great equipment to enable you to carry out the varied work required
Some of these visits will be the urgent first visit where the building occupants need your assistance to deal with a fire or flood crisis
On that first visit you need to listen carefully to the customer to understand their needs and concerns -this is essential, as you are the person who is going to help them see the way forward
then, with their agreement, carry out work to stabilise the environment and
- installing equipment to control the humidity:
- carrying out processes to remove air-borne particulates following a fire
- finding and releasing trapped moisture
- installing remote sensing technology to enable us to monitor the moisture conditions on our web portal
- record your inspection of the property and work required on our mobile app, so that the project moves forward in an organised way
Other later visits are then required to progress the work you noted was required such as:
- install more complex high pressure drying systems
- carry out strip out of damaged building components
For the “Field Technician & Incident Supervisor” role in Richfords you need a special set of skills:
Comfortable communicating with people of all types from the vulnerable to the very wealthy.
Good at taking responsibility, able to make your own decisions, problem solve and able to display leadership qualities when needed
Love practical work and experience real satisfaction when you get things done
Willing to work out of hours on an emergency incident
Comfortable that overtime working is a fairly normal requirement of this role and may result in working 48 hrs per week, on average, during busy periods (or more if you sign the optional working time directive opt-out)
Does this role seem like a really good fit for you? If so, we’d very much like to hear from you.
After you apply Indeed.com will send you a brief assessment quiz. Please complete this assessment.
Covid-19
We have safe working practices in place and are able to provide our services and maintain social distancing.
Job Type: Permanent

Monarch Automotive are recruiting a Qualified and Experience Vehicle Technician we would like you to have completed and passed at least an NVQ3 or be the holder of equivalent Manufacturer Qualifications
I would be extremely attractive if you are qualified to carry out MoT Testing as well as being a qualified technician
You will be working on a variety of cars and vans, all makes and models are dealt with at Monarch Automotive
It will be an extremely varied job, that will include regular routine servicing, breakdown repairs, MoT Repairs, cylinder head gaskets, cambelt changes, coolant systems air conditioning system repairs and routing maintenance, this is not a definitive list, just an outline.
We are a Bosch vehicle service centre and this brings the opportunity to train and achieve the Bosch Master Technician and Hybrid Master Technician.
We also train our staff to complete four wheel alignment using the Hunter Computerised Wheel Alignment equipment, ADAS Training is also offered so that you are proficient in recalibrating intelligent vehicle radar and active cruise control systems.
F Gas Training is offered so that you can safely and legally discharge repair and recharge vehicle air conditioning systems
Hybrid Awareness is offered and if you have a desire to proceed on to the full hybrid qualification we are happy to support you
Fitting & Balancing wheel and tyres including TPMS rechecking and recalibrating
We have many different computerised diagnostic systems so that we can cover most vehicle makes and models
There is also an opportunity to train on safe handling and control of vehicle safety restraint systems including airbag systems.
All Training and Career Development is supported and fully funded by Monarch Automotive
We are recruiting skilled, focused, enthusiastic, motivated and talented technicians that have a positive can do attitude to work, people who are dedicated to go the extra mile in delivering an outstanding customer service experience.
To apply up load you CV and we will be in touch almost immediately

Job Summary
Wymarsh Commercials are seeking an experienced, enthusiastic HGV technician for our mobile servicing, maintenance and test preparation team. The successful candidate will be able to demonstrate the ability to work independently to a high standard and to deadlines as well as being a good team player.
The role is varied, busy and interesting with a huge variety of vehicles and type of work, therefore there are plenty of opportunities to learn new skills for the right candidate. The successful candidate will be supplied with a modern service van equipped with specialist tools, PPE and a mobile phone.
Candidates should have a strong work ethic, able to work on own initiative, be able to make sound decisions, be reliable, have a methodical, tidy approach to work and have experience of servicing, repairs and preparing HGV's for testing. A full UK driving licence is essential, an HGV licence is advantageous but not essential.
Candidate Duties and Responsibilities
Servicing, repair & defect work of LCV and HGV Vehicles - car technician wishing to learn HGV's considered
LCV - HGV Pre MOT Inspections to DVSA standards
Sourcing and ordering parts
Fault diagnosis
Working directly with customers
Candidate Essential Knowledge, Experience and Skills
Hold a valid UK driving licence
Proven track record in similar field and be competent in servicing, brakes, clutches and routine inspections and repairs to defects.
Good working knowledge of all makes of HGV's an advantage. A large variety of vehicles are maintained, serviced and tested.
The ability to prioritise workload and work in a systematic and organised manner to ensure that repairs are completed to a high standard in a timely manner.
Work calmly under pressure
Show good initiative and enthusiasm
Be able to problem solve and deal with situations which arise during the repair process
Additional Candidate Attributes (Desirable but not Essential):
LGV Category C driving license
Fabrication skills
Knowledge of DVSA legislation
HGV Maintenance and Repair NVQ
Benefits/Salary:
Salary: Depending on experience. Overtime payable at time and a half. We are offering a competitive salary with call out and stand by payments.
Varied, busy and interesting role with huge variety of vehicles
Opportunity for professional development
Courses and training available if desired
Modern service van
Specialist equipment & PPE
Mobile phone
Workplace pension
7.30- 17.00. 28 days holiday a year including bank holidays. Overtime regularly available on weekdays and weekends.
About the Business
We are a fast growing, dynamic company keen to find an individual with a positive working attitude and the drive to help a business grow. At Wymarsh Commercials, we pride ourselves in our service and wish to maintain the high standards its reputation has been built upon.
NOTE TO RECRUITMENT AGENCIES- we deal with our own staff recruitment and do not wish to be contacted at the present time by an agency. PLEASE DO NOT CONTACT US.

Monday to Friday

vehicle technician: 3 years (Required)

Important note:
To our wonderful friends and followers around the world, Jagex is not pausing its search for the most talented people to join its ranks. We’re a successful, robust and growing business, after all.

In light of the current situation concerning coronavirus, we have already made changes to the way we recruit, and of course are mindful of following all necessary processes to ensure the safety of our staff and anyone we might come into contact with.

Jagex has switched to working almost entirely remotely, and in line with that our recruitment and selection process has moved to an entirely remote one with video calls being the preferred method of interview.
Our hiring managers are engaged, we are well-prepared and we sincerely look forward to talking to you soon. Our team of expert recruiters will be in touch with you to talk you through the process and changes and what to expect.
So, don’t delay, get that application in today!

Company Overview:

A leader in creating deep and engaging experiences on PC and mobile, Jagex was founded in 2001 and is today one of the UK’s biggest and most respected video game developers and publishers.

Famed for its flagship MMOs RuneScape and Old School RuneScape, Jagex has welcomed more than 260million player accounts to its world and created a $1bn lifetime franchise revenue. Today the RuneScape franchise exists beyond running games in live operations; our titles are living games that connect and inspire millions of players, with content and experiences both inside and outside of inexhaustible game worlds.

Both RuneScape and Old School RuneScape, on PC and mobile, offer ever-evolving, highly-active worlds and our community-focussed development ethos empowers players to have a real say in how each game is shaped.

Jagex is expanding and extending its portfolio with fresh franchise titles, new IP and, in 2018 launched Jagex Partners, delivering third-party publishing and operational services exclusively for the living games of the future.

Jagex employs more than 400 people at its Cambridge headquarters and is on the hunt for talented people to work across the business to help the company to achieve yet another year of record growth and player satisfaction.

As Senior IT Technician, you will take ownership of both simple and complicated IT issues and requests from across the company. Your goal is not only to resolve these issues directly, but also to enable other IT Technicians to resolve similarly complicated issues and requests effectively; by driving the definition, improvement and adoption of all IT support and troubleshooting procedures.
You will drive employee efficiency by providing a first-class IT support service via phone, e-mail, chat, IM, remote control or in person, as well as by managing customers’ queries in an effective and professional manner.
You will have a good understanding of all the different services that IT offers and will use that understanding to make sure that complex issues or requests are escalated to the appropriate IT support team.
This role will allow legions of gamers to play our games, by enabling our Studios and Commercial areas to create the best possible games. If you are a passionate gamer with a strong IT background, do we have the job for you!
Responsibilities
Provide world class IT/Customer Liaison
By taking ownership of customer requests, issues, and complaints – always making sure to respond in a timely fashion and to follow the appropriate escalation procedures.
By ensuring that customers are kept informed of the progress of their issues or requests, as well as the resolution by managing expectations at all times.
By understanding the game delivery / update schedule so you can help prioritize issue resolution relative to business value.
By logging all customer issues & requests on the IT ticketing system, understanding and establishing customer needs, and collecting relevant information & diagnostics needed for investigation & resolution.
Requirements
Proven commercial experience in a similar support role.
A customer service focus, with an excellent ability to handle customers effectively; with a qualification or work experience in a customer-facing environment.
Exceptional interpersonal skills, with a focus on listening, questioning & team working skills.
Ability to present ideas & troubleshooting procedures in business-friendly & user-friendly language.
Proven analytical & problem-solving abilities, combined with excellent attention to detail.
Have excellent organisational & prioritisation skills, ability to complete multiple projects in a timely manner & can work efficiently under pressure.
Company Benefits:

- Flexible Working
- Bonus Scheme
- Private Health Care
- Gym Membership
- Generous Pension Contributions
- Life Insurance
- Free Cycle Repair
- Income Protection
- Dental Plan
- Free Fruit and Drinks
- Subsidised Canteen

Feel like you fit this role, but don’t meet all the requirements? We strive for fresh perspectives, so as long as you can demonstrate how your attitude and other abilities might make up for any gaps we would welcome your application!
Jagex are an equal opportunities employer and positively encourages applications from suitably qualified and eligible candidates regardless of sex, race, disability, age, sexual orientation, gender reassignment, marriage or civil partnership, pregnancy or maternity, religion or belief.

We are looking for self-employed and qualified nail technicians to join us and deliver nail services at home.
Find new clients and work on your own terms with Urban - a platform designed to connect qualified nail technicians with clients for at-home treatments in London.
Why join Urban as Nail Technician?
Truly flexible work: our easy-to-use app lets you set your availability when it suits you

Personalised promotion: your profile showcases your skills and experience to build better long-term relationships

Feel safe and secure: from personal alarm systems to location monitoring, supporting your safety is a top priority

Admin-free: you do what you love, we do the rest, including managing your bookings and payments, and protecting your income in the event of late cancellations

Get paid weekly: earn up to £47 per treatment - plus 100% of your tips - and additional bonus after completing 5 treatments on the platform

Be part of a family: our community is 2,000+ strong, plus our team of experts are on hand for whatever you need, 7 days a week

Our Master Technicians are highly regarded, and their expertise is incredibly valued by our customers, colleagues and manufacturers. We know how much hard work and passion goes into achieving a Master Technician accreditation, and we would like to reward this!
More than 40 years of passion, hard work and innovation has seen Jardine Motors Group grow from a family-run vehicle dealer operation to one of the largest car dealer groups in the UK. Jardine Motors Group represents 16 luxury and premium manufacturers including Audi, Porsche, BMW, Mercedes and Ferrari in over 60 locations across the UK.
We have a clear strategic focus to deliver an unparalleled level of service for every customer; our competitive edge relies on the quality of the people recruited into our teams. With people at the core of our strategy we are discerning about whom we employ, and expect our employees to have high levels of integrity, be passionate about their role and take ownership of their customers’ and colleagues needs in line with our values.
Duties, Responsibilities & Person Specification
To perform all work assigned in a timely manner, economically and to Company and Manufacturer’s standards
To advise Workshop Supervisor if additional work is required on a vehicle and seek their assistance and authority in the rectification of faults
To maintain a high level of competence for the work to be undertaken by undergoing on-site training, attending courses at suppliers and manufacturer’s and reading technical bulletins as required
To discuss with customers, problems with the vehicle as requested (Total Involvement).
To ensure the Company image of professionalism and quality of service is maintained when dealing with customers
To operate equipment and carry out all duties in a safe manner.
To maintain equipment, protective clothing and work areas in a clean, tidy and safe condition
To assist management with the introduction of new methods of work designed to improve efficiency
Relevant Experience & Qualifications Required:
NVQ Level 3 qualified or equivalent.
Previous experience within a main dealer is desirable although not essential.
Master Technician accreditation or equivalent.
Be able to comply with all company and manufacturer’s disciplines and procedures.
Why Us?
As part of our mission to the best motor retailer as judged by you, we believe in offering a collaborative and innovative environment, removed of bias or stereotypes, where everyone can feel comfortable to bring their whole self to work and therefore enabling all talent to shine.
When you join Jardine Motors Group you will have the opportunity to develop a fast-moving progressive career, and assume accountability for delivering the highest levels of service. We believe that by identifying your potential and investing in your future, you will be able to develop skills and gain the experience that will enhance your career prospects.
In addition to receiving a competitive salary, you will also have access to a range of other benefits including:
33 days of annual leave (including bank holidays) + your Birthday off, if it falls on a working day.
Monthly commission scheme.
Enhanced Maternity/ Adoption/ Paternity leave options.
Pension scheme and life assurance.
Vehicle purchase schemes (across all JMG brands) and preferential parts, service and labour rates.
Employee care helpline.

An unusual but exciting new vacancy has arisen for a Junior Graphics Technician reporting to the Graphics Team Leader. This is a fixed term 12 month position. The successful candidate will assist the Graphics department with manufacture, fitting and wrapping of vinyl’s for all internal and external customers. There will be continuous in-house training provided.

Key Accountabilities / Duties include:
To assist in manufacture and fitting of vinyl graphics.
To assist with full vehicle wraps.
To assist with the manufacture and application of paint masks.
Visit external customers to fit graphics.
Travel abroad if required.
Candidate Profile:
Previous experience of a sign shop or graphics department or environment.
Some knowledge on Vinyl installation processes.
Excellent attention to detail and able to follow a given brief.
Good communication skills.
Ability to work under own initiative and part of a team.
Full driving license.
Flexibility in hours and a can-do approach is required, along with the ability to learn and work in a team, under high pressure and to strict deadlines with minimal supervision.

Benefits:

We demand the best from our people. So it’s only right we reward them with the best benefits. That’s why we offer a competitive package, including: life assurance, private medical cover, 25 days holiday, on-site gym, and subsidised restaurant facilities.

About us
Whilst we have built our reputation on tyres and exhausts, Kwik Fit is a very different place these days; the vast majority of our centres now offer servicing, MOT’s and general mechanical repairs. In fact, we are the largest provider of MOT’s in the country. We have made massive investment in developing our centres to ensure they have the latest, state of the art tools and equipment, which means that we are ready to test almost any brand of vehicle that comes our way.

Our drive to be the best means that we need to provide a fast, efficient service with high quality being the priority. We also recognise that our people want to progress in their careers and that’s why training is high on our agenda; we have state of the art training academies as well as a 24/7 online learning facility, giving our people the real opportunity to take their careers to a whole new level.

We might be a large, National Company but our centres are a real part of the local community. There’s a real friendly, down to earth, family feel where life-long friendships are made.

If you want to know more ring 0333 020 0500.

The role
Our Service Technicians, play a major part in keeping our customers safe and on the road. Whether they are carrying out one of our ‘fixed price’ services or a full manufacturers service, our customers rely on us to maintain their vehicle so it’s one less thing for our busy doctors, nurses, teachers, hairdressers, plumbers, mums and dads to worry about.

Working in a fast paced environment on almost every brand of car, interacting with customers and fixing their problems means every day is exciting and different.

Key accountabilities
You’ll also see our Service Technicians replacing timing-belts, brakes, steering and suspension components, as well as carrying out wheel-alignment with the latest state-of-the-art geometry equipment. You will also be ‘rolling up your sleeves’ and providing a range of other services, all the time whilst working to the highest standards to provide outstanding customer service – this is what it’s all about for us.

So if you are looking for a new challenge and you are prepared to work hard, you consider yourself to be friendly with a real caring attitude and you have real pride in your work you may be just what we are looking for.

Skills & experience
We are looking for;
Minimum 2 years’ current experience in a service, maintenance and repair technician role
Basic vehicle diagnostic skills
A relevant industry qualification (desirable)
Own your own tools (desirable)
A full UK driving licence
The ability to interact with our customers effectively
Experience of working in a team
Act on your own initiative and take responsibility for the quality of your own work
Behave in accordance with our core values and principles, and treat people with respect and courtesy.
The willingness to constantly learn and be able to improve your own performance

Benefits
Heard the one about hard work being its own reward? That’s true here. Our centres aren’t just places to work, they’re places where people pull together and get the best from each other. And they’re places where life-long friendships are made.

What’s more, we partner with some of the best premium tyre and part brands on the planet and invest to keep our equipment state of the art, keeping you on the cutting edge of what’s possible.

That’s what we mean by ‘you can’t get better’.
#YCGBSMR

Job Description:
JRNI is a scheduling platform for delivering and managing personalized experiences at scale, helping companies build customer relationships, increase revenue, and grow brand loyalty.

It’s an exciting time to join us, we’re in a steady state of growth, supporting Enterprise household brands globally with our complex software. We have offices in the UK, Australia and two in the US, and are always looking for talented, driven people to join us! Life at JRNI is fast-paced and hands-on. We empower everyone by giving autonomy and exposure to real-life commercial decisions every day and we love seeing people grow and progress in sync with our business!

Working in a fast-paced agile environment, we’ll support and train you to confidently respond to technical queries from our clients, troubleshoot issues creatively & technically and successfully navigate our in-house systems.

With our help, you’ll eventually be able to;
Respond to technical queries from customers and prospects
Diagnose and solve platform issues yourself
Assist with the configuration of customer booking systems
Log and keep records of customer queries using ZenDesk and JIRA
Follow up and make scheduled call-backs to customers where necessary
Identify and escalate priority issues; redirect problems to appropriate resources
Independently test changes to the platform
Work remotely via Slack with the rest of the Customer Support Team
Collaborate with other departments such as Engineering, Product and Development
The role requires the following skills:
You’re curious and you love to solve problems
Preferably, you’ve got a Computer Science / Business Information Systems degree
You’re personable, approachable and you really enjoy a collaborative environment
Being the main point of contact for some of our largest clients, you understand the significance of exceptional customer service
If this sounds like you, we’d love to hear from you! Our strong, values-driven culture makes JRNI a great place to work! We care deeply about the growth and happiness of every member of our team. We offer out of office personal learning days, discounted dental and healthcare and free virtual GP access, weekly yoga, monthly social events and regular training, company shares, and flexible working to help you strike the right balance. If you’d like to help us drive this even further forward then please apply now!

All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, religion, gender, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, national origin, genetics, disability, age, or veteran status.

The above noted job description is not intended to describe, in detail, the multitude of tasks that may be assigned but rather to give you a general sense of the responsibilities and expectations of this position. As the nature of business demands change so, too, may the essential functions of this position.

The position requires a competent and highly motivated hands-on team player to ensure that the Company’s products are tested and validated against specific requirements. These include compliance with Functional Design Specifications (FDS’s), Test Plans, internal quality procedures, industry and legislative standards and against specific contractual requirements. The ability to work in accordance with procedures and to fully support excellent working practices (including health, safety and environmental excellence) are essential. This position includes direct customer liaison which requires an extremely positive and “can do” attitude.
Requirements:
Experience in the field of testing of PLC / HMI / SCADA System Hardware and Software are essential. This will include the knowledge of the various communication PLC / HMI / SCADA protocols and an understanding of PLC / HMI / SCADA testing techniques and methods.
Ability to interpret electrical drawing and excellent fault diagnostic skills.
Commercial awareness.
Health and Safety awareness.
Excellent IT skills.
Educated to a minimum of an ONC in Electrical Engineering (or equivalent).
Official / prior certifications, such as NICEIC.
18th Wiring Regulations.
Educated to a minimum of an ONC in Electrical Engineering (or equivalent).
Tasks and responsibilities (but not limited to)
The key objectives of the appointment are to:
Review all the relevant documentation contained in the “Test Package” – including, but not limited to: The FDS; I/O Schedule; System Architecture, and Software Application Revision. Ensure that the Internal Factory Acceptance Test (IFAT) commences in accordance with agreed procedures and schedule.
Diligently and safety perform the IFAT, thoroughly undertaking system functionality checks and testing as specified by the FDS / Test Plan / specific requirements. ‘Negative testing’ will be carried out in order to validate the robustness of the system.
Fully and accurately complete all relevant documentation in line with Company procedures and the requirements of the Project / customer.
When correct to do so, sign-off the FDS / Test Plan / Specification, Correction and Omission Sheet(s) and any other relevant documentation.
Investigate any non-compliance and repair (if possible) and / or liaise with the System Integration Team in order to remedy all faults identified. Corrections must be tested and verified using established procedures / documentation.
Following the successful completion of the IFAT, in consultation with the customer / customer’s representative, perform the Customer Factory Acceptance Test (CFAT). This may take place at any location as specified by the Project / Contract.
Liaise with other departments and personnel to ensure the smooth and efficient progress of the project throughout the entire test phase.
With responsibility for the completion and accuracy of test documentation, liaise with colleagues from other departments to ensure that all certification and QA / QC requirements are adequately met / completed.
Advise stakeholders of progress and any potential problems at the earliest opportunity.
Ensure that the Test Area (wherever located) is exceptionally clean, orderly and house kept. In particular, ensure that test equipment, apparatus and cabling does not present a hazard.
Ensure that during testing, the area is cornered off / arranged in accordance with Company procedures and only those persons authorised and competent are present.
Demonstrate strong and effective inter-personal and communication skills and the ability to interact professionally with a diverse group of clients and personnel.
Attend customer’s sites whenever required always upholding the Company’s Culture and Values.
Lead excellent working practices, including:
Health, safety & environmental compliance.
Data protection & information security.
Customer focus.
Team Behaviour.
Housekeeping.
Continuous improvement.
Compliance with the Company’s Business Assurance System.
STRICTLY NO AGENCIES

As part of our Support Team expansion in our Brighton Head Office Applied Systems, a worldwide leader in insurance technology is currently searching for Support Technicians at 1st Line and 2nd level to become a part of our outstanding Support team, which plays an essential role in keeping Applied Systems at the top of the insurance technology industry. In this position, you will assist our clients with any question or problems they may have regarding software, hardware, or any other products purchased from our company. You will provide friendly, informed, and efficient customer service via telephone, Internet chat, and email.
The Support Team
The Support Team comprises of the Helpdesk with 3 tiers, 1st through to 3rd Line, the team are the first point of contact for customers for post-sales product-related technical support. It is also a communication channel into other customer-facing departments such as Business Development, Consultancy and Training and provides mechanisms for customer feedback. Each member of the team is an ambassador for the company and we strive to offer the highest levels of customer service at all times.
RESPONSIBILITIES
Respond quickly and efficiently to incoming calls in line with defined answer-time targets, providing product and technical support, escalating calls as appropriate in line with Support Call Logging Procedures
Provide guidance to customers for training related issues via help guides and recorded training sessions
Assess importance of call in-line with Service Level Agreements (SLAs) and refer/escalate accordingly making sure all steps have been taken and recorded within incident management system prior to escalation
Record accurately and efficiently log relevant call details and investigation notes using the incident management system, making sure that all recorded symptoms and the customers desired outcome are recorded to ensure ease of understanding of issue raised and to enable appropriate prioritization allocation
Manage own and next level line queue of cases, through investigation to resolution, working effectively and responsibly to ensure client satisfaction
Take ownership and be proactive in obtaining answers from other sources in order to meet SLAs
Ensure customers are kept up-to-date with the progress of calls
Assist with the creation of knowledgebase documentation as requested
QUALIFICATIONS FOR THIS JOB
GCSE English and Mathematics grade C or equivalent
A Level or equivalent in IT or able to demonstrate competent working knowledge/experience working with computer systems, operating environments/Microsoft Applications
Strong written and verbal communication skills; strong telephone skills
Ability to demonstrate experience of delivering a high level of customer service
Ability to demonstrate a high level of problem solving capabilities and approach
2 years minimum in a technical support role ideally combined with 1+ year of customer service experience
Demonstrable experience and knowledge of hardware and networks
Demonstrable experience and knowledge of SQL
Multi-tasking capabilities and ability to thrive in a fast paced environment
A team player as well as have the ability to listen, to accept responsibility, and to cooperate and communicate with others to accomplish goals
Ability and desire to expand with changing marketplace and technology
Conflict-resolution capabilities and the ability to deal with emotional and/or difficult callers
Ability to plan and organize technical projects; experience with deadlines for project completion
Must be eligible to live and work in the UK
WHO WE ARE
LEADING GLOBAL PROVIDER OF CLOUD-BASED INSURANCE SOFTWARE- Applied Systems develops the top two Insurance Agency/Broker Management software products in the world. In addition, we also provide innovative mobile apps, Data Analytics, Customer Self-Service, Insurer Connectivity & Rating, eServicing, Benefits Design, and CRM software products. By automating the insurance lifecycle, Applied’s people and products enable millions of people around the world to safeguard and protect what matters most.
CLOUD SOLUTIONS & PROFESSIONAL SERVICES- We offer cloud solutions, 24x7 technical support, consulting, implementation, and education services.
AWARD WINNING TECHNOLOGY- We have been voted
2020 Company of the Year (Stevie Award)
2020 New Product or Service of the Year- 2 awards (Stevie Award)
2019 Best Cloud-Based Software Solutions Provider in the insurance industry (2019 Corporate Excellence Awards)
2019 Digital Service Provider of the Year (Business Excellence Awards)
2019 Best Broker Software Management House (Insurance Times)
GOOGLE’S INVESTMENT IN APPLIED- Google/CapitalG made a minority investment in Applied that will spur AI, machine learning, and digital marketing innovation in the global insurance industry.
CLIENTS- We provide technology to over 160k users within insurance agencies, brokerages, and carriers throughout the US, Canada, the UK, and Ireland.
EMPLOYEES- Applied currently has 1,800+ employees across the US, Canada, the UK, and Ireland.
COMPANY CULTURE & BENEFITS
JOIN A GREAT TEAM- We believe that success comes from a dynamic working environment that offers professionals an opportunity to grow and succeed alongside extraordinary people. We encourage idea sharing, problem solving, and teamwork in our environment.
HEALTH & WELL-BEING- Applied offers Private Medical Insurance, cycle to work scheme, and schemes to support employees.
FINANCIAL PEACE OF MIND- Competitive salary, and Pension Scheme with employer matched contributions.
WORK-LIFE BALANCE- There is more to life than work. That is why Applied offers benefits to help balance your work and home life. We offer paid time off including weeks of paid vacation leave, company sick time, paid holidays, summer hours, and 1 free day off for your birthday!
RELAXED DRESS CODE- Applied allows for a relaxed dress code where jeans are permitted; we call this “Dress for your Day”!
FUN PARTIES & PERKS- Fun perks are a staple at Applied, including holiday parties with games and contests, summer BBQ, employee appreciation events, art contests, personal and professional development programmes, car parking season ticket loan, and more!
OPPORTUNITIES FOR ADVANCEMENT- We are a growing company that offers career opportunities, and not just “another job”. Applied believes in growing our employees and promoting from within, offering many opportunities for professional advancement along the way!
CAREER STABILITY & LONGEVITY- Our average employee tenure is 9 years.
CULTURE OF RECOGNITION- Applied provides a culture of employee recognition with our Circle of Excellence program, and our internal social network recognition program.
APPLIED CARES- We have a culture that embraces and promotes volunteerism. Applied encourages our employees to help local charities and communities through the ‘Applied Cares’ program.
TO LEARN MORE
To learn more please visit our
UK website: Appliedsystems.co.uk
IE website: Appliedsystems.ie

A Multi-Skilled Technician delivers best-in-class planned, preventative, and corrective maintenance activities associated with gin distillation and processing on the Bombay Sapphire Distilling, Laverstoke site, which comprises tanker operations, spirit storage, gin distillation and all associated utilities and facilities.

Key metrics within Spirit Supply Operations are achieved

Spirit Supply assets, equipment and engineering systems are aligned with Bacardi standards

EXPERIENCE

FUNCTIONAL SKILLS
·Demonstrable experience working safely in a manufacturing / processing environment within a maintenance department or comparable technical services team.

·Experience of instrumentation and PID loops.

·Comp EX Ex 1-4 qualified
MECHANICAL EXPERIENCE

·Fluid transfer systems / pipework

Prep Paint Technician
Main Job Purpose
To ensure the repair of motor vehicles of all types is carried out to motor manufacturer industry standards or repair methods.
To carry out such work in an efficient, safe and economical manner, ensuring the integral quality of the vehicle and its safety is maintained.
To employ such knowledge and skills as may be required to restore vehicles to an industry recognised acceptable standard.
To ensure that non-productive time is kept to a minimum.
Main Responsibilities and Duties
To observe, recognise and report on vehicle structure and paintwork.
To ensure that vehicles comply with safety standards when returned to customers, or that faults have been reported and noted on the job card.
Removal and safe storage of vehicle components, fluids and gases as directed by work order.
Removal and safe disposal of vehicle components and fluids as directed by work order.
Quality control of all repairs, with final stage sign off.
To report all faults, defects noticed whilst working on vehicles.
To take care of equipment, special tools, personal tools and report any faulty equipment to your line manager.
To actively make sure the repair method is in the job pack and is fully read, understood (e-scribe, manufacturer or other source) and displayed with the vehicle at all times.
To observe, recognise and report on vehicle structure and paintwork.
To interpret and implement technical service instruction data.
To indent for replacement parts and record usage.
Paint repair – to be able to accurately use paint mixing schemes, computerised scales, spray booths and drying lamps.
To keep work floor areas clean and tidy.
To keep spray booth and bake booths clean and tidy.
To ensure that vehicles comply with safety standards when returned to customers, or that faults have been reported and noted on job card.
Application of topcoat to manufacturer’s specification.
Preparation of repaired areas as directed by work order, in readiness for application of topcoat.
General workspace cleanliness, protection of vehicles for overspray, booths and push through ovens emptied and compactor emptied.
Experience and Skills
· To have a minimum of 3 years experience in the Body repair of motor vehicles.
· Motor manufacturer qualifications and experience.
Knowledge of latest Waterbourne Technology.
Aware of composite and aluminium repair.
Bonding, sealer and filler repair skills.
Driving licence.
Machine polishing including hologram removal.
Motor manufacturer led training.
Paint manufacturer led training.
Personal Attributes
· Team Player
· Use initiative, be flexible and have a can-do attitude
· Cultural and organisational insight
· Adaptable and tenacious with the stamina required to follow through
· Takes responsibility for own actions
· Innovative approach
· Takes pride in doing the right thing in line with company culture
· Honesty

About the role

It’s no secret that we are a rapidly expanding population and that we need to preserve our food production systems, whilst reducing our environmental impact. At Better Origin, we have developed insect rearing and processing systems to convert our organic waste into insect biomass, an alternative protein source that is highly nutritious yet has a low environmental impact. Feeding insects to livestock improves their health and welfare, resulting in happier and more sustainably farmed animals.
Job Summary
We’re looking for hard-working, passionate individuals who love to drive change, want to drive positive impact, and thrive in a start-up environment to provide technical and practical on-farm support for our users in the poultry sector.
Better Origin is offering the right candidate a full-time role, focused predominantly on managing and delivering operational support for our insect mini farms located on poultry farms throughout the UK. You will have the opportunity to take on a hands-on role supporting and enabling the technical success of the Better Origin insect mini-farms with UK egg producers and packers. You will work with, and be supported by a highly innovative passionate team.
Role Specifics
To be hands-on with the day to day running, management and maintenance of the mini-farms which includes handling larvae and interaction with farmers on farm
To provide support to farmers to ensure the onboarding and smooth operation of the technology applied, and to provide this through effective and efficient remote communications combined with an on-farm presence
To support broader internal insect farming and breeding operations
To provide the engineering team with frequent constructive feedback from farm to support further design iterations of the product
Be willing and flexible to travel locally and nationally
Essential skills and qualifications
Be able to work autonomously and be able to prioritise activities effectively
Excellent written and verbal communication skills and be confident with the application of each
Ability to build, hone and maintain relationships
A good team player
Excels in a start-up environment
To be a practical, hands-on type person who enjoys interacting with farmers
Not afraid to get hands dirty!
Clean UK/EU driving licence & access to a car
Be able to work remotely
Desirable skills
Experience in the use of Microsoft packages
Prior experience or knowledge of the farming sector, specifically poultry/laying hen sector
Benefits:
Fun and dynamic start-up environment and team
Competitive package
Company laptop
Company pension scheme
Minimal red tape and hierarchy!
Food waste, animal welfare, food security, climate change – there are so many challenges facing our planet. But there is a solution; the solution is nature and using insects to fix the broken food system, and Better Origin is bringing that solution to market.
Better Origin is an innovative and exciting Cambridge-based SME working to improve our food chains.

Smith's is a family run business, owned and run by the Smith family since 1982. It has now grown to one of the largest of the waste management companies in the South-West. We are now looking for a qualified mechanic to join our main Transport Workshop in Eastington, near Stonehouse.

We are looking for a skilled workshop-based HGV fitter to work from our Eastington depot in a busy and varied transport environment.
The successful candidate will carry out 6 weekly inspection schedule in line with VOSA guidelines ensuring defects are completed in a timely cost effect manner taking instruction from the workshop manager when required or a senior member of staff. The successful candidate will also enjoy a varied role and be able to work under their own initiative. Training for the role will be supplied where required.
Experience with plant equipment would be beneficial as from time to time there would be a need to carry out small repairs on some of our plant machinery, mainly hose replacements and the odd oil change when required.
A full UK driving licence is required. A HGV licence would be beneficial as the role can include taking vehicles for brake tests and Tacho calibrations.

Company Description
