Job Description

The electrical technician will support the delivery of the plant by driving a problem solving and autonomous mindset. Set in a fast-paced environment with good team ethics as an electrical technician you will utilise your extensive experience to deliver against core KPI’s that support the continuous improvement of the plant.

Key Responsibilities;
Take an active part in maintenance and repair of Plant and Equipment, including PM, AM, and breakdown work as required.
To work as a close-knit team to actively drive the resolution of plant breakdowns and resolve running issues and operate with a high level of autonomy.
Carry out all required technical duties including any relevant problem solving to minimise unplanned downtime and resolve running issues.
To be responsible for the continuous monitoring of the plant and associated equipment, actively looking for potential issues and driving to resolve before they impact production.
To actively lead and participate in CI & GE improvement activities.
Maintain good levels of housekeeping in all areas of the plant.
To attend and actively participate in OPS/production meetings and RCA sessions. Reporting plant status and identifying escalations as required.
To undertake operational training of areas of the plant
To actively support the operational team to meet volume demands
Active use of SAP to log breakdown data, correctives and booking parts out of Stores
Take accountability for your own ongoing development with a demonstratable plan
Qualifications
Experience and use of SAP maintenance programme, or the ability to learn
Actively assists in development of planned maintenance routines
As part of a small working group the successful applicant will be expected to be self-motivated, flexible and prepared to take on a range of responsibilities without the need for supervision.
It will be advantageous to have some knowledge of P.C. based Plant Operation, coupled with sufficient Technical knowledge and/or aptitude to meet the demands of the role.
Able to demonstrate strong problem solving skills and experience
Effective communication skills both verbally and in writing
Electrical specific:
Able to demonstrate good understanding of relevant British and Industry standards for Electrical engineering
Apprenticeship in electrical discipline with experience in a technician role.
Minimum of ONC or equivalent qualification in Electrical Engineering
Proven PLC fault finding and configuration skills with specific knowledge of Rockwell PLC5, CLX; AB Powerflex drives; Kinetix Servo control, Factory Talk View and Industrial networks.

UK Skills Growth Academy is an Education Training Provider part of Shaw Trust and Ixion Holdings, who are the largest charities in the UK provide and support skills development programme to the school leaver, unemployed, job seekers, a career changer or someone who looking to up-skill in the current role.
This role is offered by Ixion Holdings and manage by UK Skills Growth Academy Tower Bridge Centre.
Role Overview:
This role is support Level 3 Diploma in Nail technology qualifications under VTCT awarding body through the Government Funded Advanced Learner Loan contract to ensure learners achieve their maximum potential throughout the programme. To provide a varied programme of delivery in line with the required qualification specifications and offer an integrated programme of teaching, training, support mentoring and development of learners. Quality teaching must be adhered to in line with Awarding body standards and UK Skills Growth Academy Scheme of Works to ensure timely achievement of learner goals and qualifications as per Company and Regulating Bodies KPIs.
Principle Accountabilities:
Engagement of learners and delivery of a high-quality service – meeting KPIs set for enrolments and attendance confirmation through to the completion of qualifications.
Deliver qualifications offered where occupationally competent in accordance with the Quality Assurance process
Effectively maintain a caseload of learners (at agreed and specified level)
Highlight and where appropriate deal with learner issues and provide focused learner support, and identifying and providing additional learning support where required.
Develop and use a range of techniques and resources tailored to learner’s individual needs – supporting them throughout their learner journey towards successful achievement and completion of qualifications.
Maintain learner information, ensuring quality and integrity of data which is accurately recorded and submitted efficiently to meet contractual requirements
Work with the direct line manager to maintain and improve quality of delivery across all programmes – including success rates, observations of learning, performance management.
Take an active part in Team and Standardisation meetings
Take an active role in preparation toward Ofsted inspections as well as taking part in inspections as requested – This includes but is not limited to striving to achieve and maintain standards – including maintaining own CPD and maintaining occupational competence in areas of expertise.
To be accountable for sourcing each month an agreed number of new learner applications as agreed. These will be monitored by the line manager as part of the KPI performance measures of this role.
Identify new opportunities, referring learners as required to further progression, maximising direct delivery opportunities and maintaining caseloads.
Core Competencies
You are required to demonstrate a number of core competencies
Self-management – manage workload effectively
Relationship management – develop and maintain productive relationships with your Team, Management, Clients, Partners, and all key stakeholders.

Competent in use of IT including Microsoft Word, Excel and PowerPoint to intermediate user level

Apply now!

About us
Everyone knows Kwik Fit for our tyres, but these days we do a whole lot more. Servicing, fleet services, fast-fit – whatever comes our way, our teams have what it takes to get the job done properly. And whilst half of our MOT and service appointments are booked in advance, either online or over the phone, we are still ready to save the day for customers who need us at the drop of a hat. You could say we’ve learnt to expect the unexpected!
That’s what it’s all about for us – being there for customers in their hour of need and delivering friendly service of the highest quality when they need it most. It’s what makes our centres a valued part of their local communities.
And we’re just as dedicated to our staff. With Kwik Fit you’ll be given every opportunity to develop your skills using state-of-the-art equipment and working with some of the biggest brands out there.
Sounds good, doesn’t it? That’s why we say, ‘you can’t get better’.

The role
As a Mobile Technician you won’t just ‘be there’ for our customers – you’ll be out in the field, travelling to them to help in their hour of need. In your own Kwik Fit van, you’ll be a welcome sight to both retail customers and the Kwik Fit fleet. Receiving the day’s jobs through your PDA device, you’ll be taking care of everything from puncture repair to tyre fitting – whatever it takes to save the day.
Experiencing new people and places – not to mention the weird and wonderful tyre problems you’ll encounter – there’s no shortage of variety and plenty of opportunity to use your finely tuned people skills as well as your mechanical wizardry. By joining our team, you’ll be sharing your skills with the best in the business at a company where career development and training are a priority. If you’re already on your way to being a great auto technician, Kwik Fit will get you there faster.

Key accountabilities
No two days are the same at Kwik Fit – doubly so when you’re out on the open road rather than being based at a centre. Who knows what kind of tyre problems you’ll be fixing from one day to the next? Truth is, though, you wouldn’t have it any other way because you love giving it your best. Never giving up until you’re able to work out what’s going wrong. Getting stuck in until you’ve identified and fixed the problem. All the while making sure our customers and team members feel well looked-after in your capable hands.

Skills & experience
Our friendly service and top-level mechanical expertise is a winning combination that makes us heroes in the community. Striking that balance as a Mobile Technician requires a special skill set including:
The kind mechanical/vehicle knowledge that puts customers at ease
Strong customer service skills and customer rapport
Excellent route planning skills
Current driving licence
Fluent English, spoken and written
Good time management skills
A methodical approach to problem solving

Benefits
Heard the one about hard work being its own reward? That’s true here. We’ve got state of the art training academies, online learning and all the support you need to reach your full potential.
What’s more, being the UK leader for tyres and auto care means you’ll be part of the team that is shaping the future. We’ve been working in partnership with the Government to tweak innovations like digital MOTs and other to-be-revealed initiatives. Plus, we’re constantly developing new resources, from state-of-the-art equipment, to help with the most modern of vehicles, like hybrids, to creating a market leading website and having partnerships with some of the best premium tyre and part brands on the planet.
That’s what we mean by ‘you can’t get better’.

The individual that would suit this position would be a bright, enthusiastic and energetic person that is able to interact in a professional manner with a large body of people in the laboratory areas in Autolus.Working as part of the Laboratory Operations Team, this person will work in co-ordination with the Lab Support and Lab Operations teams providing inventory, operational services to internal stakeholders across multiple sites.

Assist with the day-to-day control and upkeep of managed stocking points across two functional sites, (Kanban’s)
The successful candidate would have both an energetic and motivated approach to all daily routine activities and be strongly motivated to learn and improve both their role and knowledge base.
The role will require the candidate to be responsive to any rapid changes in processes or environment and be capable of making independent decisions.Direction will be provided by the Laboratory Operations Specialist on a routine basis and will be involved in other areas as required. This will involve cleaning, restocking or replenishment of all general use areas and items as directed.
As this is a service function it is very important that you are a team player and understand how to work in line and across functional elements of the wider operations team. You must be customer orientated, good stakeholder engagement skills, have an understanding of safety and quality processes and a willingness to learn. Effective communicator to anyone as required. Ability to be responsive to urgent requirements and can have a good understanding of priorities through any working day. The candidate will show proven records of both attention to detail and all the above in order to maintain the high standards required of all employed at Autolus.
Key Responsibilities
Replenishing Points of Use (POU) for different materials in various locations and sites.
Understand and influence the supply chain of materials used through to endpoint replenishment.
Replenish stocks of decontaminants, such as chemgene.
General upkeep and hygiene within laboratory areas.
Ensure temperature and CO2 controlled environments are within acceptable ranges, undertaking reactive measures when not.
Maintain general use equipment, such as centrifuges and Miltenyi flow cytometers.
Respond to laboratory stake holder requests and queries.
Liaising with engineers and company representatives for equipment repairs.
Internal communication to team for immediate activities required.
Upholding laboratory health and safety practices as per risk assessments and policies.
Ensure COSHH compliance within the laboratories
Ensure the equipment and materials required for transporting biologicals between sites are present.
Assist with laboratory audits, either from internal teams or external auditors.
Urgent physical stock movement between sites, (when required).
Assist with ongoing Kanban set-up, uncontrolled floor stock and back-flushing.
INDHP

Our growing Technology and Design team plays a key role in ensuring OS is at the cutting edge of geospatial capability and is looking for people to join them. Its mission is to work across the business to provide customer centric design and technology services.
Join us and you’ll have an opportunity to make an impact. To empower projects that deliver real-world benefits across Britain and internationally. To hear our customers say they couldn’t have done it without us. As an Asset and Software Associate Technician, you’ll join our thriving IT Services team to help maintain and improve software applications and asset management databases. You’ll work to meet customer and business requirements and support effective delivery.
You’ll be responsible for supporting improvements to the software and hardware asset lifecycles, improving the quality of data within asset databases and completing audits. Working on essential tasks within the Application Delivery systems which includes checking applications and creating applications from evidence, supporting upgrades, testing, and maintaining the offerings within the Application Delivery systems to ensure currency and compliance.
You’ll work closely with internal users, support teams and colleagues within your own team. Thus, you should be good at managing your time and meeting deadlines, prioritising your work and have excellent communication and investigation skills.

Company Overview

Established in 2015, nChain is providing the tools and techniques for a scalable, stable, and secure infrastructure in global trade. Our focus is to enable global adoption and enterprise-level usage of the Bitcoin SV blockchain.

With over 10 years of research pertaining to blockchain technology and information security, nChain is in a unique position to use its intellectual property and technical knowledge to help enterprise clients take full advantage of the blockchain.

With access to such a diverse and rich portfolio of intellectual property, and our experience in working with some of the largest enterprises across financial services, Fintech, manufacturing, iGaming, and supply chain, nChain has given our clients a unique insight into what is possible by using the blockchain.

We know that great technology needs great people. That’s why we offer unique opportunities to work with some of the greatest minds in blockchain.

Company Culture

nChain is headquartered in London, with a current workforce of 75 people, focusing on 3 key areas: professional services, research, and development of enterprise-driven solutions.

Our open-plan offices enable our people to work with some of the greatest minds in the industry.

We are a young company, with backgrounds spanning across the globe, ever-growing through new initiatives and ideas. We're fast-growing, diverse, and fun-loving. Join us and find your edge.

We are looking for smart people who are able to work quickly with highly skilled peers. Our team is small and distributed but very high functioning. They need to participate in the requirements review and give valuable feedback to the business.

We are seeking an experienced IT Field Technician who’s role would be responsible for support and maintenance of the fast moving and ever changing technical environment across a number of locations in the UK. This will be on a 12 month fixed term contract basis.

The candidate would provide a mix of on-site, remote and telephone based support. Also, may be required to visit any site within the Lookers plc group. You will be the BAU technical contact for the region and will be expected to travel accordingly as circumstances dictate.

You’ll need to manage your own regular schedule of site visits while liaising with other field techs in your region to provide a responsive, high quality service and maintaining the department’s profile.

Internal and manufacturer specific projects will arise and you will be expected to participate and take responsibility, liaising with manufacturers and managing the integration and support of their systems with our own.

Skills & Experience

The successful applicant should be flexible and adaptable, have the ability to work on their own, to be a self-starter and to manage their own time. The candidate would respond to user issues logged with the service desk that specifically require assistance onsite. These tasks include, but are not limited to;

Installing & supporting end users’ systems (Microsoft O/S and Office experience essential). Good working knowledge of software and hardware fault finding and repair.

o Supporting PC’s, laptops, printers, IP phones, mobile phones and tablets, PDQ card payment machines, scanners & fax machines and a wide scope of automotive manufacturer systems.

o Knowledge and experience with Windows 7/10 essential

o Good working knowledge and experience in networking, installation, fault finding and repair.

o Working knowledge of Active Directory

o IP v4 networking, DHCP & DNS

o Working knowledge of Enterprise level Wi-Fi technology & troubleshooting

· Assist in major ongoing I.T. projects, such as;

o Windows operating system upgrades

o MS Office 365 rollout & migration

o PC/laptop replacement program

o Active Directory / email migration

o Next Gen Wi-Fi upgrade

o Wi-Fi migration

o Group wide DMS upgrades

It’s essential that the field technicians are great with people, listen, empathize and own users’ issues through to resolution. Field technicians represent the I.T. department whilst visiting the various locations in the group and hence must present themselves and the department with the suitable manner, dress and appearance.

Qualifications

Must have at least 2-5 years’ experience of working it I.T. support role.

2 years previous working experience in a field technician/engineer role. (preferable).

A sound foundation of computer knowledge, excellent troubleshooting skills, patience, excellent communication & organizational skills

Good interpersonal skills and the ability to deal with people with varying degrees of IT knowledge.

ITIL qualification (preferred) Industry specific professional qualifications, i.e. Microsoft, Cisco (preferable) Degree relevant to I.T. industry (preferable)

Working conditions

There will be occasions where the role will demand extended working hours, work into the evening and weekend support, sometimes at short notice. The role will require a lot of traveling. The role will occasionally require periods where overnight accommodation is required outside of your normal place of work, to support project and BAU activities. Lifting of small units of equipment will be required. Must hold a full clean driving license.

Job Title: Energy Efficiency Technician - Multi-tradesperson - Insulation Installer
Job Description:
Energy Efficiency Technicians
Multi-tradesperson - Insulation Installer
Reporting To: Operations Manager
Deadline &Term: ASAP, Permanent, Full Time
Package: Salary + Performance Related Pay or Options Scheme
Location: London / South East
Travel: Frequent travel across the UK required
Are you looking for an exciting opportunity to develop your trade or engineering skills, using robots to deliver innovative new services such as floor insulation?
Are you keen to work with a dynamic, fast-moving operational team using your skills and experience to survey and insulate homes across the UK?
Would you like to work with colleagues on resolving technical challenges on site, including testing innovative and unique tools and equipment?
Q-Bot is a fast-growing robotics and AI company based in London and the north east. We are working in partnership with social landlords and private owners across the UK. We use robots to install underfloor-insulation with a BASF polyurethane (PU) foam developed and certified for this application. The robot is inserted under the floor through an access hatch, surveys the void and condition of the floor, if suitable sprays an expanding insulation foam to the underside of the floor and finally records the install to verify the area and depth of insulation applied.
As an Energy Efficiency Technician, you will join Q-Bot’s operations team to take a lead on the installations, making things happen on site as well as working in the office to track and manage projects. The role will be hands on and involve both on-site and off-site training with a view of gaining growing independence. There will also be increasing management responsibilities in line with the delivery of larger programmes of insulation works.
This position is based in London (Wandsworth) but will involve travel. The candidate will be required to work at sites across the UK. Work away will typically be between 1 and 5 days, at least once or twice per month. Accommodation and expenses will be paid by the company whilst you are away.
Key Responsibilities:
Surveying properties with the help of our robots and collating energy assessment information from site.
Using the company’s robots to install or retrofit under-floor insulation across a variety of properties.
Ensuring quality control and customer satisfaction, including liaising with the management, customers and contractors.
Engaging with the Research & Development team feeding back site problems and suggesting improvements.
Testing innovative solutions and helping to run experiments both in the field and the lab.
Executing tasks on site including retrofitting of insulation and general building work.
Implementation of site health and safety, risk assessments and method statements.
Keeping accurate records, developing systems where necessary to ensure appropriate records
Supporting tests and demonstrations to meet accreditation requirements.
Organising the workshop environment and ensuring it is tidy at all times.
Undertaking any other tasks/duties as may be reasonably required.
Essential requirements:
Full UK Driver's License with residency in the UK for a minimum of 3 years.
Willing to learn and adapt to new skills
Able to plan projects, manage time, resources, and work to deadlines.
Drive and determination to get the job done.
Able to work effectively both as part of a team and individually.
Desirable attributes:
Knowledge and practical experience working in the built environment and construction industry.
Experience of spray foam insulation and its application.
Experience of retrofitting insulation, for example loft or cavity wall insulation.
Experience of quality control or health and safety requirements.
Training
You will be able to take part in our own in-house training course and receive on the job training on a regular basis. External training including surveying and energy assessment techniques can be provided if required.
Recruitment
Q-Bot is an equal opportunities employer and welcome applications from all suitably qualified persons regardless of their race, sex, disability, religion, belief, sexual orientation, or age.
Please apply with your cover letter and CV.

Role
We have a fantastic opportunity for a motivated and experienced maintenance and small works fabric technician to join our dedicated Planned Preventative Maintenance team on our contract for London Borough of Bexley.

Your role will be to make sure the assets are maintained to a high standard and you will have the ability to respond to reactive repairs and carry out routine repairs.

Careers & Development
Because our business is growing and becoming more complex, developing, supporting and coaching our people becomes more important. Whatever your area of expertise, you can expect ongoing learning opportunities that will help you develop your unique abilities to the full.
We hold individual performance management discussions yearly. These discussions are there to help you to understand your strengths and development areas, to create your personal job plan and to find learning solutions for you.
Essentially, it’s all about helping you recognise you’re potential. For example, we operate innovative company-wide development programmes, and we give existing employees the opportunity to fill new vacancies as and when they arise by advertising all posts internally. Whatever your level of experience or area of expertise, you can look forward to ongoing training and professional development that’s tailored to your specific needs.

Are you looking to enhance your technical abilities within a supportive and highly successful family-owned business? Then look no further! An exceptional package awaits the successful candidates including a highly competitive salary, pension, up to 25 days holiday, tool allowance, company vehicle, mobile phone and laptop, and intensive training and support to assist you with your professional growth.
Please note, experience of working with professional groundcare/golf machinery is an essential requirement for these positions.
Farol is one of the leading John Deere dealers in the UK with people at the heart of its strategy. We know that our people are the key to our success and we make sure we appreciate and reward everyone's contribution. Not only do we recognise expertise, skills and professionalism, we value highly the very things that make them unique: their passion, their dedication, their approachability and the fact that going the all-important extra mile is second nature.

Minimum qualifications:
Bachelor's degree or equivalent practical experience.
Experience with operating systems and networking protocols.
Experience with computer hardware and server hardware or troubleshooting/diagnosing.
Ability to travel across Europe up to 50% of the time.
Preferred qualifications:
Experience in project management and leadership.
Experience working within a data center or network operation center environment.
Experience in maintenance and monitoring of server systems.
Experience with Linux operating systems.
Ability to collaborate and partner with teams to overcome challenges.
About the job


Google isn't just a software company. The Hardware Operations team is responsible for monitoring the state-of-the-art physical infrastructure behind Google's powerful search technology. As an Operations Technician, you'll install, configure, test, troubleshoot and maintain hardware (like servers and its components) and server software (like Google's Linux cluster). You'll also take on the configuration of more complex components such as networks, routers, hubs, bridges, switches and networking protocols. You'll participate in or lead small project teams on larger installations and develop project contingency plans. A typical day involves manual movement and installation of racks, and while it can sometimes be physically demanding, you are excited to work with infrastructure that is at the cutting-edge of computer technology.

Behind everything our users see online is the architecture built by the Technical Infrastructure team to keep it running. From developing and maintaining our data centers to building the next generation of Google platforms, we make Google's product portfolio possible. We're proud to be our engineers' engineers and love voiding warranties by taking things apart so we can rebuild them. We keep our networks up and running, ensuring our users have the best and fastest experience possible.
Responsibilities
Contribute and lead efforts/projects in the deployment, maintenance and support of data center infrastructure.
Lead complex troubleshooting and resolve escalated technical challenges over a significant population of affected equipment.
Help test and troubleshoot new server hardware components and designs.
Configure and troubleshoot OS-related issues on server.

Google is proud to be an equal opportunity workplace and is an affirmative action employer. We are committed to equal employment opportunity regardless of race, color, ancestry, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, age, citizenship, marital status, disability, gender identity or Veteran status. We also consider qualified applicants regardless of criminal histories, consistent with legal requirements. See also Google's EEO Policy and EEO is the Law. If you have a disability or special need that requires accommodation, please let us know by completing this form.

An IT Support Technician is required by a growing company based in Poole. The company is seeking someone who has a strong technical support background on an IT service desk.

Overall purpose of the post
As a consequence of its rapid growth, Ivy Learning Trust is looking to recruit an IT Technician to join our growing Central Team. The role will involve providing IT technical support to all the schools within the Trust (currently 8), with a main focus on our Hertfordshire schools, as well as providing IT support to the Central Team.
Being able to drive and have a car is essential for this role.(Please note that mileage claims will be accepted for trips relating to work, this excludes commuting.)
As well as relevant experience, the successful candidate will have a flexible and can-do approach to whatever tasks they may be asked to fulfil the ability to work well with others and the confidence to use their initiative when required. The successful candidate will be supported by the ITNDM but at times independent working will be required; in these situations the successful candidate must be able to demonstrate a successful problem-solving attitude and prioritise work appropriately.
Main duties and responsibilities
Support and training
Maintaining a comprehensive database of all support and fault requests and, with support, prioritising according to need.
Responding to faults raised through the IT helpdesk.
Providing support to staff and pupils as required in relation to the technical aspects of IT hardware, software and cloud-based software. Due to the issues raised the successful candidate may be required to liaise with outside parties,
Support various types of hardware including: PCs, laptops, tablets, printers, copiers, interactive whiteboards/panels, sound systems and any other hardware/software not listed.
Infrastructure and equipment
Supporting the ITNDM in the effective operation and management of the IT network of the Trust.
Supporting the ITNDM with supporting physical and virtual servers.
Supporting the ITNDM with the creation and management of all network user accounts, ensuring correct access rights in a domain environment.
Supporting the installation of software / hardware as requested and maintaining a record of all installations carried out.
Maintaining an up-to-date database of ICT licenses ensuring the trust is meeting its legal obligations.
Support with the creation of network shares and printers ensuring users have the correct access.
Support with ongoing maintenance and upgrade of both hardware and operating systems.
System and Information Security
Supporting the implementation of system and data back-up procedures ensuring that in the event of data loss the backups are fully functional.
Support with management of GSuite across the Trust.
Ensuring that the security entry system is maintained, that staff and visitors have relevant access and ID badges are issued.
Producing reports as requested in relation to timekeeping.
Supporting with the maintenance of all email and distribution lists within the Trust.
Maintaining the asset register for all schools and the Central Team.
Support with Antivirus protection, ensuring the domain is regularly checked for viruses or malware.
Notes
This job description should not be viewed as a comprehensive description of the post. Whilst every effort has been made to explain the main duties and responsibilities of the post, each individual task undertaken may not be identified.
Employees will be expected to comply with any reasonable request from those in a position of responsibility to undertake work of a similar level that is not specified in this job description.
English fluency: The ability to converse at ease with members of the public in accurate spoken English is essential for the post.
All schools and services in the Trust are committed to safeguarding and promoting the welfare of children and young people. Therefore, all workers and employees within the Trust are expected to share this commitment.
The successful candidate will be required to undertake an Enhanced Disclosure via the Disclosure Barring Service (DBS).

Bouygues E&S are seeking to appoint an EC&I to support our Energy from Waste facility in Hoddesdon.

Role Purpose:
Provision of timely and professional day to day scheduled maintenance, fault finding and breakdown activities to the E/C&I systems on site, in order to maximize plant performance and availability, while maintaining high standards of Safety and Environmental performance.
Duties:
Implementation and delivery of Bouygues Health, Safety and Environmental management policies within your sphere of influence.
Performance of designated Safe System of Work responsibilities as defined by the Bouygues Advanced Thermal Treatment Safety Rules.
Assisting in the development and implementation of the site Computerised Maintenance Management System (Maximo).
Assisting in the development and delivery of maintenance techniques and procedures directed at increasing overall plant availability and performance.
Performance of troubleshooting, routine, scheduled and major repair maintenance on electrical, electronic, pneumatic, hydraulic, IT and DCS systems.
Testing and calibration of E/C&I systems and field equipment in accordance with OEM supplier requirements and Industry Good Practice.
Quality control of all work associated with Departmental activities on site, including supervision and control of sub contractor works as required.
Provision of close technical support to Operations and other site teams.
Active participation in site Safety forums, including periodic procedure and Safety System reviews.
Active participation in site initiatives and projects as required.
Supporting outage planning, co-ordination and management.
Desirable & Essential Criteria:
Essential:
City and Guilds/NVQ level 3 in an Electrical or Instrumentation Engineering discipline. (Qualifications below this level may be acceptable if accompanied by suitable experience)
Comprehensive, practical experience in the maintenance of process related E/C&I equipment.
Full understanding of P&IDs, loop checking and electrical drawings
Comprehensive working knowledge of analogue and digital instrumentation calibration regimes.
A flexible approach to out of hours call out, and changes to working patterns where necessary to the needs of the business.
Knowledge and understanding of electrical distribution systems, their protection and switching.
Desirable Criteria:
Comprehensive knowledge of preventative maintenance and defect repair/interrogation on: DCS/SCADA, PLCs, analogue and digital instrumentation and transducers, Continuous Emissions Monitoring Systems.
HNC/ONC in an Electrical or Instrumentation Engineering discipline.
NEBOSH or IOSH qualification.
Knowledge and experience of Electricity Supply Industry standard Safe Systems of work, Safety Rules and Permit for Work Systems.
Together with our partners and clients, Bouygues E&S delivers award-winning construction, development and regeneration projects to the most exacting standards across public and commercial private sectors.
Bouygues E&S is part of the Bouygues Group, a diverse global business which operates in the construction, engineering, energy, media and telecommunications markets.
With annual sales of over €32 billion and operations in over 100 countries, the financial strength of our group is a key differentiator in these challenging economic times.

On a mission to repair the country's smashed smartphones and tablets.
Could you be our local hero?
What would you do if your phone broke? Could you cope without it? No? Well, neither could we!
That’s why we are recruiting local repair technicians to become local hero’s.
At a time where staying connected via our phones or tablets is more important than ever, our technicians have now become unsung heroes of the nation. Across the breadth of the UK, our technicians ensure that no phone or tablet is left out of action.
Our technicians have designated regions close to home but travel in a WeFix branded VW van that is fully equipped to fix any device with any problem.
But what do you need to become a local technician?
Live in the area we are recruiting for as this will be your region.
Previous experience in electronic device repair
Full clean driving licence & be over the age of 21 for insurance purposes
Outstanding communication skills
A passion for technology & customer service
Got all the above? Then we are on our way to becoming an unstoppable team!
Are you our local hero? Apply today!
WeFix serves the growing demand for convenient, rapid smartphone and tablet repairs through its fleet of 60 mobile workshops providing 94% coverage of the UK population. The acquisition by Brightstar created synergies and new experiences for its device protection and after-sales service customers.
In 2018 WeFix became the first – and only – manufacturer-approved mobile smartphone and tablet repairer when it entered into an exclusive agreement with Samsung to provide in and out-of-warranty device repairs to its UK customers.
WeFix is a smart, flexible way to repair a smartphone or tablet. WeFix also offers a completely contact-free service allowing consumers and business users to get quickly re-connected to their device even during the COVID-19 disruptions. Additional measures have been put in place so there is no customer contact and all devices are thoroughly sanitized before they are returned to the customer.
Brightstar plans to increase WeFix’s UK fleet to up to 150 mobile workshops by the end of 2020.

Mobile Phone Repair: 2 years (Preferred)

UK Drivers (Preferred)

Job Purpose
Working in conjunction with ITM’s Logistics Facilities Supervisor, the Logistics and Configuration Technician will be responsible for the managing and organising of daily logistics tasks including (but not limited too): pre-stage configuration, asset tracking and shipping of Client owned network equipment to ensure timely delivery to onsite project teams. You will also be responsible for any client owned equipment being returned to ITM to ensure that it is correctly documented and disposed of in line with Client requirements.
The successful candidate will have good computer skills and knowledge of Microsoft Office applications such as Word/Excel etc. An eye for detail and outstanding verbal and written communication skills are also essential.
As a List X company, we will request as a condition of employment that you gain SC and relevant customer security clearances.
Key Accountabilities
The key accountabilities of this role are best defined (but not limited to) the following areas:
Pre-Staging and Asset Management
· Asset tagging and recording of all incoming customer equipment.
· Uploading of basic network/software configuration to customer specifications.
· The packaging and arranging of shipping of equipment to customer sites.
· The management of customer returns as they arrive back from site for either sending back to the originator, holding. stock or preparing for WEEE disposal.
· Erasing all data on customer equipment being returned from site.
· Maintaining a tidy work environment.
· Document builds as required.
Logistics
· Assistance in the production and distribution of laser etched and printed label requests for projects
· Ensuring customer stock movements are correctly booked in and out.
· Ensure returns (RMA) process is correctly followed.
· Collection and collation of obsolete IT equipment for WEEE disposal.
· Manage ITM warehouse stock movements and ensure they have been correctly recorded.
· Ensure a tidy warehouse area.
· Ensure H & S policy is being followed.
· Weekly clearance of recycling waste from warehouse and office areas
· Ensure general waste and recycling skips are booked to be emptied on a regular basis
Person Specification Essential Behaviour and Skills/Competencies
The successful applicant will have the following experience and competencies:
· Demonstrable technical knowledge and experience of switch configuration and programming
· Client focused with a drive to deliver excellent service
· Organised, detail orientated and punctual
· Excellent eye for detail
· Outstanding communication skills
· Able to multi task
· Flexible to take on additional tasks/responsibilities
· Experience in project coordination
· Microsoft Excel, Word and Outlook
· Full UK driving licence
Desirable Behaviour and Skills/Competencies
· Experience of using a Customer Relationship Management system
· Experience of using Office 365 including SharePoint/Yammer
· Educated to GCSE level (Maths & English minimum)
· Forklift truck licence (training can be provided)
· CCNA qualified
· Microsoft Project
· Experience of using a Customer Relationship Management system
· Experience of using Office 365 including SharePoint/Yammer
Application Deadline: 13/11/2020
Job Types: Full-time, Contract
Salary: £23,000.00-£25,000.00 per year
Benefits:
Company pension
On-site parking

Monday to Friday

We have followed the Government Guidelines and taken the necessary steps to protect the health and safety of all employees.

Ensure that ICT equipment and work stations meet the requirements of health and safety legislation and are maintained in a clean and safe manner

Job Description:
Location:
Huntingdon and Cambridge

Xaar Values:
Xaar has defined 5 values which are vital to our business; each represents an area of essential importance to us. Their existence is intended to guide difficult decisions and shape behaviour.

Creative – we push the boundaries of what’s possible

Collaborative – everyone is a partner; we help each other freely and willingly

Innovative – we always strive to constantly improve

Integrity – we deliver on our promises

Passion – we care about our technology, our products, our partners and each other

Purpose of Role:
The IT Support Technician has responsibility for providing support to colleagues across the business in person, over the phone or online. The assistance provided can range from servicing requests for IT software or hardware through to resolving technical issues and maintaining Xaar’s software and computer equipment.

This role will also support the IT Infrastructure Engineers to deliver IT projects.

IT Infrastructure Manager

Responding to Service Requests and Incidents logged on the IT Helpdesk system

Ordering supplies, maintaining IT stock and dealing with hardware and software vendors

Processing starters and leavers, including delivering IT inductions to new starters

Installing and configuring hardware and software

Setting up user accounts for colleagues and maintaining security group memberships

Creating IT training materials and documenting IT hardware and software

Key Challenges:
Ability to work in a fast paced, diverse IT environment

Communicate clearly and confidently with colleagues at all levels of the company

Willingness and enthusiasm for continual learning and self-development

Providing a professional service to colleagues

Willing to work flexibly, in varying locations and participate in the on-call support rota

Person Specification:
Motivated, enthusiastic self-starter

Excellent organisation skills, able to manage workload and priorities with minimal supervision

Knowledge of IT hardware and software and willingness to learn

Logical, structured approach to analysis and problem solving

Strong customer service ethos

Full UK Driving License

Experience of:
PC hardware, Windows 10, Windows 7 & Windows XP

PC maintenance (including hardware and software) and Printer Maintenance

MS Office suite including Outlook. Word, Excel, Access, PowerPoint

Supporting Microsoft Office and Office 365

Supporting Networked Desktops and Laptops

Active Directory user, computer, and group administration

Troubleshooting network connectivity
How to apply

If you think you're a good fit for one of our vacancies, we would love to hear from you. Please email your CV and covering letter to recruitment@xaar.com

Please note, we are only able to accept applications from people who are already eligible to work in the UK.

By submitting your CV, you are consenting to Xaar Plc processing your personal details in relation to potential job vacancies and, if your application is successful, to administer your personnel record.

As an IT Apprentice, you will be working closely with the Head of Digital learning to support the requirements of the School.
You will have a keen interest in IT and working closely with other departments you will need to build relationships with both internal and external customers.

The Role

Specific duties will include (but aren’t limited to):
the timely and accurate logging of staff issues into the IT helpdesk
recognising when a helpdesk request is urgent and escalate accordingly
carrying out configuration and testing of new kit prior to install at customer site
We are looking for you to develop the role so that, in time, you become the first point of contact for all incoming issues to the Helpdesk – freeing up the Head of Digital Learning to concentrate on the strategic plans for ICT development at the School

About You:
We expect you to be self-motivated, efficient and well-organised with a keen eye for detail. You will be IT-literate with skills in the use of Microsoft Office, in particular, Outlook, Word and Excel.
You will also have a strong background in ICT / Computer Science (eg GCSEs in Science, Technology or ICT / Computer Science).
You will have a interest in working in a school environment and especially proving technical support in Music, Drama and Design and Technology.

Hours of Work:
The post is full-time 37.5 per week. You may be asked to work the occasional weekend to support major school events.

The Apprenticeship:
You will complete a Infrastructure Technician Level 3 Apprenticeship which will last 18 months.

Other Information:
A DBS check required will be required for this position.
Interview Dates will be Week Commencing 7th December with a possible start date of the 4th January 2021.

Are you an enthusiastic individual looking to get into the world of I.T?
Are you looking for a fun and friendly working environment that gives the opportunity to learn lots of new skills?
Do you want to earn money whilst gaining first-hand experience as well as an IT qualification?
If the answers to these questions are yes then we might just have the perfect role for you! We’re on the hunt for a passionate IT Apprentice to join our business.
Bonacia is a family run business based in Woodston Peterborough, we’re a digital printing company with a difference, we LOVE to use technology to enhance our customers experience, and create bespoke software and workflows to allow us to do this. We don’t outsource our tech needs, instead, we keep our very talented tech wizards in-house which means you’ll have some great people to learn from.
What will I be doing?
Supporting internal & external staff with their queries – we’re sure we’ll hear you say “Have you tried turning it off and on again?”
Setting up new computers including software and hardware to ensure our teams have everything they need
Working with the IT Manager to get ‘hands on’ with in-house Microsoft servers and cloud-based linux servers
Working with the IT Manager to ensure the company’s internet, network & cloud-based phone solutions are fully operational 24/7
Analysing data and solving problems
Assisting the business marketing team with running and cleaning customer data lists
What skills do I need to have?
Full training will be given by our in-house team and partnered training provider Baltic Apprenticeships so don’t worry if you don’t already ‘know it all’ we value attitude over skill and the main things we’re looking for are;
A positive attitude and happy to roll your sleeves up and get stuck in
Someone who loves IT and is passionate about technology
Someone who loves problem solving
A confident communicator who speaks ‘Human’ as well as ‘Tech’
Pro-active and able to manage workload independently
Bonus points if you’re also interested in learning about technical Design!

There are a number of support roles on site with the majority of colleagues working within our operation.

The role will involve working as part of an established Service Delivery Team assisting in ensuring our Helpdesk team are meeting the needs of the business. You will join a team of 8 Technicians on a high volume Technical Service Desk. This is an excellent opportunity for an 1st and 2nd Line Technician to make the next step in their career working for a highly reputable local company that is a subsidiary of the world’s largest retailer.

We are growing our Maintenance Department at our busy Wellingborough facility and are looking for a talented and experienced Maintenance Technician to support our 2 shift system of earlies and lates.
Autocraft Machining Solutions’ 7,000sqm facility in Wellingborough is home to the group’s medium to high volume machining capability. AMS specialises in cylinder head & block machining, bed plates, ladder frames, EV motor & transmission casings, and structural BIW components. We have over 50 CNC machine tools, plus CMM and ancilliary equipment.
THE ROLE:
You’ll need a strong CNC machine tool maintenance background, as the majority of your time will be spent on both preventative and reactive maintenance on our wide range of 3-, 4- & 5-axis CNC machining centres. You’ll be very skilled at fault-finding and repairing components, you’ll relish the challenge in this!
Previous experience working with CNC machining centres is therefore essential, and in particular Matsuura, Heller and Grob will be advantageous. You’ll know your way around Siemens and Fanuc CNC controls, and will be committed to safe working within the boundaries of these machine tools.
In addition to the CNC machining centre maintenance, you’ll also be maintaining assembly equipment, and even undertaking general building maintenance, so experience in all forms of maintenance is required.
(Please do not apply unless you have CNC machine tool maintenance experience, as it is essential for this role and unfortunately those without this relevant experience will not be considered).

A completed apprenticeship in Engineering is desirable, preferably NVQ Level 3 or higher in Maintenance Engineering (Mechanical or Electrical)
Proven track record in maintenance of CNC machine tools
Multi skilled in both electrical and mechanical disciplines
Strong background in planned preventative maintenance systems
A tidy, organised person committed to continuous improvement
INTERESTED?:
If you meet all the requirements above, please submit your CV detailing all your relevant experience and qualifications with a covering letter stating why you're perfect for the role!

About us
We’re the biggest provider of MOTs in the country. In fact, it’s us the government come to when they want advice on their latest MOT initiatives. But more importantly, it’s us our customers turn to when their car runs into trouble. And we save the day, every day.
That’s what it’s all about for us - being there for customers in their hour of need and delivering friendly service of the highest quality when they need it most. It’s what makes our centres a valued part of their local communities.
And we’re just as dedicated to our staff. With Kwik Fit you’ll be given every opportunity to develop new skills using state-of-the-art training facilities so you can progress your career and reach your true potential.
Sounds good, doesn’t it? That why we say “you can’t get better”.

The role
All-rounders don’t come more brilliant than Kwik Fit Tyre & Auto Care Technicians. Willing and able to get stuck into a bit of everything, whether it’s changing a tyre, wheel alignment using the latest geometry kit or replacing exhausts and batteries, they’re some of the most helpful and hardworking people in our business.
It’s about carrying out your work to high standards and delivering great customer service alike. One is just as important as the other. So, every time a customer walks through the door, you’ll give them the sense that they’re in good hands before proving it with the service you deliver.

#YCGB

Key accountabilities
No two days are the same, here, and who knows what types of automotive issues you’ll deal with from one day to the next? One thing’s for sure, you’ll work with all kinds of makes and models of car, carrying out inspections, identifying faults and fixing them efficiently and effectively.
This is your chance to be part of one of the best loved teams in the industry, delivering an unrivalled level of service. A place where expertise and customer service go hand-in-hand. If you’re looking for a career in the auto industry, this is where you want to be.
After all, it’s the perfect entry into a wider career within the Kwik Fit business. If you’re looking to develop, we offer some of the best training in the industry.

Skills & experience
Our customers come back time and time again because they trust our teams. To be a great Tyre & Auto Care Technician, you’ll need:
Some experience in an autocare or fast-fit technician role, ideally
Working knowledge of maintaining tyres, exhausts, batteries and wheel alignment
The desire to learn as much as you can, quickly and enthusiastically
A full UK driving licence
A great way with people so you can not only slot right into the team but really make our customers feel welcomed and confident
Experience in a similarly team focused environment
A strong interest in a career in the automotive industry

Benefits
Heard the one about hard work being its own reward? That’s true here. Our centres aren’t just places to work, they’re places where people pull together and get the best from each other. And they’re places where life-long friendships are made. We’ve got state of the art training academies, online learning and all the support you need to reach your full potential.
What’s more, being the UK leader for tyres and auto care means you’ll be part of the team that is shaping the future. We’ve been working in partnership with the Government to tweak innovations like digital MOTs and other to-be-revealed initiatives. Plus, we’re constantly developing new resources, from state-of-the-art equipment, to help with the most modern of vehicles, like hybrids, to creating a market leading website and having partnerships with some of the best premium tyre and part brands on the planet.
That’s what we mean by ‘you can’t get better’.

Data Center Operations designs, installs & maintains the worlds largest Cloud Computing Infrastructure.

We are looking for skilled Data Center Hardware Engineer with a passion for technology to help us expand our Cloud to the next level.
Amazon Web Services (AWS) offers an exciting, dynamic and challenging environment encouraging creativity and personal development while maintaining AWS computing environments in a secure, scalable, and cost-effective manner.
To keep up with demand on both disk and network capacity, we continue to expand our Data Centers in every region. Also, our content delivery AWS service, CloudFront, has expanded its Data Centers presence by over 50% worldwide in the last 12 months and are expecting to increase by a similar number over the next 12 months. This requires talented people to build & manage. We hope it is you!


At Amazon, career progression is part of our environment. We want you to progress. If your career path is in Systems, Network or Database Engineering, Software Development or maybe AWS Support, Technical Operations or perhaps Project Management, we will create a development plan to enable you to succeed reaching those goals. This begins on Day One!
Come and work for the worlds most Customer Centric Company.

The Opportunity: Data Center Hardware Engineer


This role is a unique opportunity to work in some of the most cutting edge data centers in the world. Amazon data centers are large-scale high-density centers where you will be working on changing the face of Cloud technology in the region.

A Data Center Hardware Engineer may be the primary point of contact for both internal customers (for example: Network Engineers, Systems Engineers, Software Developers, Database Engineers, Technical Operations) and external customers (Hardware Vendors, Contractors, Service Providers among others).


There is never a dull moment as each day presents itself with different challenges. Some of the key responsibilities you will undertake are:


Problem Solving:
· Maintain a high level of system reliability by prioritizing and resolving trouble tickets efficiently, these include:
· Escalation point and technical troubleshooter for all Systems and Network hardware problems
· Deep diving into Linux server issues
· XEN service virtualization troubleshooting
Technical:
· Troubleshoot technical issues on various platforms ranging from Systems through Networking to Power/Mechanical
· Remediation of physical layer outages, both Systems & Network
· Remediation or recovery of physical power issues on racks
· Participate in Data Center power & cooling events
Operations:
· Meet 24x7 On-Call requirements and response during shift rotations.
· Install & configure racks of hosts in line with internal SLAs
· Triage & resolve trouble tickets for all devices in your region
· Data Center point of contact for all High Severity issues
· Physical replacement of server and network device parts
· Ensure correct rotation of parts & spares
· Help define metrics to increase our customer uptime
· Enforcing Amazons Security Best Practices
· Interact with third party vendors & contractors
· Contribute ideas to improve operational efficiency
· Engage with Remote Hands & Eyes in EU Regional Cloudfront POPs

Project Management:
· Participate in and deliver on a number of high impact small to mid-scale projects
· Participate in team meetings for metric analysis and project status updates
· Help build the worlds largest Cloud infrastructure
Mentoring:
· Share knowledge and help educate less technical staff on the best practices related to all service owner issues
Hiring:
· Contribute towards building a great team by getting involved in the Amazon hiring process/candidate interviews

Basic Qualifications

· Solid Understanding of Linux/Unix Administration
· Server Hardware Troubleshooting experience
· Server Booting: POST, BIOS, PXE, Kickstart, GRUB/LILO, RAID
· Some Experience with Network Protocols: TCP/IP, Ethernet, L2/L3 technologies
· Network Hardware: Copper and Optical Fiber Cabling, Switches, Routers
· Strong Communication Skills
· Passionate about IT infrastructure and hardware!

* This position also has a physical component requiring the ability to lift & rack equipment up to 40lbs; it may require working in cramped spaces or in elevated locations while adhering to health & safety guidelines.


* This role involves covering 24x7 shift rotation
* Applicant must hold a valid drivers license


Preferred Qualifications

· Remote Access: Console routers, IPMI, BMC
· Network Equipment Installation and Configuration
· Cisco IOS, NX-OS, JunOS
· Redundancy: Power feeds, ATS, Server Hardware, RAID, Network Connectivity
· Data Center Operations: Inventory Management, Hot/Cold Aisles, Security
· Experience with Excel and the ability to manipulate data and create necessary charts and diagrams
· Participated in Project Management
· Experience or Knowledge of AWS products: EC2, EBS, S3 etc.
· Scripting: Bash, Python, Perl, Ruby (or programming languages)

What will you contribute?

This position will provide onsite support for End User computer devices such as laptops/desktops, mobile devices, video conferencing equipment, and printers. The candidate will support VIP employees ( White Glove). The role will support incidents, service requests, IT onboarding and offboarding as well as basic IMAC responsibilities. The role will follow Finastra Asset management polices and procedures with the deployment, recovery and disposal of assets.

Responsibilities & Deliverables:
Your deliverables will include, but are not limited to, the following:
Manage Desktops and Laptops running Microsoft Windows and Apple MAC OS using current Finastra procedures,
Manage end user devices with the existing tools supporting printers, desk phones, voice mail, Skype& Teams, application setup/support, , Mobile Devices,.
Provide support to all authorized users who access Finastra provided services, Help Desk device and software from any location, troubleshoot remotely using Finastra tools and break-fix services as applicable
Provide status and updates on lncidents/ Problems at Finastra's request and according to severity guidelines.
Coordinate Help Desk Service related act¡vities with Finastra's Level 2 and Level 3 support teams, and communicate with the authorized Users as necessary. Status communications on ticket progress with the enduser/requestor to be done and documented ¡n each ticket.
Provide support for all video/audio conference end-points at all Finastra locations. (included vendor maintenance coordination and end user operational support)
All activities in relation with White Glove Services (i.e. open new tickets, follow tickets, ensure the correct tickets closing, etc.) on behalf of the White Glove authorized user is performed by desk side personnel / or remote Help Desk support
Perform asset tracking, inventory management and monthly reporting (asset details, location)

Required Experience:
University Education or equivalent
Strong Knowledge of PC , Mac Windows 10 and iOS
Strong Customer Service and communication skills

About Spin
Spin is a fast-growing micromobility company committed to a world with clean air, liveable cities, safe streets, and widespread access to convenient, affordable transportation. If you're searching for a top-tier career where you can make a difference and dynamically collaborate within a creative, lively environment—Spin welcomes you!
We're passionate about transportation and technology. The work we accomplish fulfills a sense of meaning and purpose, which goes beyond the traditional dimensions of a workplace. Our products and initiatives directly influence people's lives, which is proven by our customers' feedback.
Founded in 2017, and now a subsidiary of Ford Motor Company, we have worked together with cities, campuses, community groups, and businesses to expand internationally. Even as we expand, we maintain the close feeling of a small business, with "fireside chats" chats led by our company's founders, weekly OKR pop-up videos, music-infused presentations at our All Hands meetings, and more. During this time of working remotely, our creativity and shared goals have kept us united and bonded within our virtual community.
We are a diverse team of artists, engineers, designers, urban planners, policymakers, marketers, and operators. We believe in inclusivity and build powerful alliances to fulfill our goals and move our mission forward. Above all, we at Spin are connected by our values and #BeOrange spirit, which represents unity, purpose, passion, and creativity.
About the Role:
We're looking for an IT Support Engineer to join our technology team as we expand internationally. At Spin, we believe excellent technology support is vital to creating a world class employee experience. You'll have a major impact on how Spin employees use and understand technology. You'll have direct ownership of procuring technology assets for Europe and supporting a fast growing company globally. Once established, you'll be entrusted as a subject matter expert (SME) in several tools or services which will expand your own expertise and allow you to become a major asset for our growing knowledge base. This role reports directly to the Global Technology Lead.
Candidate Requirements:
Excellent communication skills: This role is all about your ability to break down complex technical ideas into simple concepts anyone can understand. Whether answering an email or contributing to project planning sessions you must be able to convey needs and solutions appropriately.
Expert in technology troubleshooting: Our ideal candidate will feel comfortable addressing any technical issue and when unsure has an "I don't know, let's find out together" mentality.
Skilled in managing IT inventory / assets: You may be responsible for hundreds of devices in your region and need to know the status of them at any given time.

Stobart Group is focused on delivering growth in its two-core operating divisions; Aviation & Energy. Stobart Group also holds a portfolio of infrastructure assets and investments.
Sampling and Analysis Support Technician - What’s the role?
Stobart Energy is happy to announce a role with the quality department. The successful candidate will provide a quality resource to external third party processed fuel suppliers and internal processing facilities. Monitor third party sub supplier analysis results to ensure consistency and compliance with contract.
The Sampling and Analysis Support Technician will carry out sampling and testing of processed biomass materials, follow methodologies and procedures for assessing incoming material and outbound finished goods.
Sampling and Analysis Support Technician - What will I be responsible for?
You will be responsible for ensuring that the correct procedures, instructions, and forms required for assessing quality of finished goods are followed. Analysing samples for moisture content and particle size distribution and bulk density where applicable. You will prepare and dispatch samples for external chemical testing and liaise with laboratories/couriers.
You will help to develop inbound/unprocessed etc quality control checking processes and procedure to ensure good quality fuel can be produced. The successful candidate will assist operations with training and guidance on good quality inbound material in line with finished fuel contracts.
The successful applicant will be rewarded with a package including company pension scheme and uniform.

Brief Description

Salary: £25,198 - £29,390 per annum (dependent upon qualifications and relevant experience and inclusive of annual allowance)
Grade: UKRI C
Contract Type: Open Ended
Hours: Full Time
Closing Date: 5th December 2020

Please note applications will be reviewed on an on-going basis and we reserve the right to close this role early.

About us

ISIS is a world-leading centre for research in the physical and life sciences, our suite of neutron and muon instruments gives unique insights into the properties of materials on the atomic scale. We support a national and international community of more than 3,000 scientists for research into subjects ranging from clean energy and the environment, pharmaceuticals and health care, through to nanotechnology and materials engineering, catalysis and polymers and on to fundamental studies of materials.

About the role

We have an opportunity for a Mechanical Support Technician in the ISIS Ancillary Plant Section, which is part of the ISIS Accelerator Division, to provide support for much of the equipment associated with the smooth running of ISIS. The section is looking to recruit a practical Mechanical Technician who has served a fully recognised apprenticeship or is similarly qualified.

The plant includes large evaporative and air blast cooler systems, water treatment plant, de-mineralised and de-oxygenated water production systems, ventilation fans and motors, chilled water systems, air conditioning units and compressed air systems.

Key Responsibilities

You will report to the Ancillary Plant Maintenance Manager within the Accelerator Engineering Group and should have:
Experience of ancillary plant systems
A sound understanding of Mechanical Engineering workshop practices
A recognised Mechanical Engineering apprenticeship or equivalent
Experience of installing pipe work
Basic experience of conventional machining
Refrigeration plant experience
The maintenance of complex ancillary plant systems both planned and reactive
Good interpersonal skills, well-motivated and able to motivate others
The ability to work to fixed schedules.
Additional Details

An on-call allowance may be available for those who wish to take up this option.

Organization Description

UK Research and Innovation is a new entity that brings together nine partners to create an independent organisation with a strong voice for research and innovation, and a vision to ensure the UK maintains its world-leading position in research and innovation. More information can be found at www.ukri.org.
The Science and Technology Facilities Council is a world-leading multi-disciplinary science organisation, and our goal is to deliver economic, societal, scientific and international benefits to the UK and its people – and more broadly to the world.

The Research Computing Services (RCS) division is part of the central University Information Service (UIS) department within the University of Cambridge. It provides High Performance Computing (HPC) and Data Services to the entire University and its affiliated institutions as well as nationally through the national HPC services such as DiRAC and Tier2 HPC. The Research Computing Services team consists of a set of highly skilled individuals delivering high quality research computing infrastructure and user services to enable better research outputs using state-of-the-art and cutting-edge technologies.

The role holder will join the existing support team and will be providing front line user support, technical assistance to the RCS user community as well as infrastructure and platform support for its many HPC and Data systems. This is an excellent opportunity for an entry position within a popular and growing area of Research Computing. The role holder will be also involved in a range of other interesting, internally and externally facing projects run by the division. We provide a friendly professional environment and opportunity to work on a cutting edge, state of the art HPC and Data platform. As part of the work within our division, we will provide training and skills development programmes to support career path progression.

The successful applicant will have appropriate experience in an all-round IT support role, storage and networking. Experience with systems integration, hardware and data centre environments and Linux system administration would be an advantage. Good communication, excellent organisation, analytical and troubleshooting skills are essential. Applicants should also be able to demonstrate initiative and ability to multi-task. About CineArk
CineArk is a rental house, supplying specialist film equipment to film and TV production companies worldwide. We also offer managed storage, maintenance and technical support services to film crew working in the film and television industry. We are a young company, but our commitment to innovation, technical excellence and customer service has quickly established us as a leading company within the industry and we already service many high- end feature films, TV productions and TV commercials in the UK, Europe and across the world.
Brief description of role
We're looking for a smart candidate who doesn't necessarily have film based technical experience, but does have a passion for electronic engineering, has a good understanding of AV and video disciplines, is good with technology and finds it easy to learn how to use new technical equipment. You will be working as part of a team of experienced, technically skilled engineers supporting the development of this exciting part of our business. The role would be suited to someone with previous experience in Audio Visual system assembly and installation and possibly has previous experience as an Electronics Engineer, AV installer
This job isn’t for everyone, or just anyone. The pace is fast, expectations are high, and resources are always constrained, but with your knowledge and skill set you will help to support many of the largest feature films produced in the UK and across the world. This role would suit somebody who has a keen interest in engineering and AV, with an established knowledge of electronics and enjoys problem solving, and with the ability to learn fast. The right candidate will be process driven with a good degree of flexibility, initiative and common sense. Will be a team player with a positive outlook and a can-do/make it happen attitude and enviable attention to detail, who can take ownership of a tasks or project and see it through to completion.
You will primarily work as a key part of our Engineering Team, modifying, building and maintaining video/audio/networking equipment, and cables and components used on film sets. You will have excellent tool skills, in particular soldering which will be a requirement from the start alongside managing client requests providing technical support.
Experience required:
· Extensive and specialised knowledge of electrical systems
· A minimum of 5 years’ experience in a technical position
· Knowledge of network and computer/ICT techniques
· Advanced knowledge of systems engineering
· Knowledge of procedures concerning the technical installation, implementation and delivery of projects.
· Understanding and interpretation of wiring designs and pin out and schematic drawings
· Above-average fault-finding skills with ability to take initiative and problem solve
· Excellent cable soldering skills e.g. XLR, LEMO and Fischer
· Excellent crimping skills with impeccable attention to detail
· Background in electronics assembly and soldering
· Computer literate - competent with MS Office - Excel, Word and Apple with ability to learn new programs quickly
· Clean driving licence.
Relevant Previous Experience
· A tried and tested installation engineer with experience of designing bespoke systems
· Previous background in AV installation or Electronics Engineering
· Repairing and soldering PCB’s
· Knowledge of component protocols e.g. RS232
· Knowledge of electrical wiring standards
· Working with complex electrical systems
Personal Attributes
Good communication skills at all levels
Conscientious and positive attitude with the ability to work under pressure.
A highly organized and self-motivating individual with the ability to work to deadlines, managing their own workload.
Discretion - working in sensitive areas of film production
Flexibility – the company priorities often change unexpectedly, and you will need to be able to change duties at short notice
Computer literate - competent with MS Office and Apple with ability to learn new programs and applications quickly
Lives within 1-hour max commute
Working Conditions
45 hours per week
Hours of Business - 8am to 6pm, with flexibility to work outside of these hours if required.
Monday to Friday – some weekend hours may be required
Holiday 28 days per year including bank holidays

ATS are looking to add a School and Business IT Technician to our team.

Established in 2002 we’re a growing support company started by techies, to create a team of engineers and technicians with a focus on relationships not sales, and we believe our success in maintaining a reputation for quality support is built on that simple principle!
