About us
The Johnsons1871 Ltd group are one of the UK’s most well-established Removals, Storage and Moving Services companies, having recently undergone a period of growth are now looking for hard working individuals to join them as HGV Class 2/1 Drivers, Furniture Fitters, Warehouse Operatives, Hardware Installers, IT Installers and various other specialised Move Team Members - Porters.
The company have been operating nationally for over 100 years and are keen to continue growing with the focus remaining on customer service and flexibility. Covering all aspects of removals; Domestic, Commercial as well as more specialist moves the business has depots across the country and provide services to everything from small businesses to major blue-chip organisations

Johnsons1871 and agencies
Where we are unable to find the people, we need ourselves, we work with a preferred supplier list of recruitment agencies (our ‘PSL’). Recruitment is managed and controlled by the Recruitment Manager, which must always be an agency's first contact point.
We receive many expressions of interest each month and unless we are specifically looking to add to the agencies we work with, we may not respond to each request we receive.
Any CV submitted either directly to a representative of the Johnsons1871 group, or by an organisation that is not a registered and authorised supplier, will be deemed to be the property of Johnsons1871.
We reserve the right to engage directly with such candidates and no fee can be charged should the candidate in question be employed, or considered for employment, by us.

Company description
We are the AA. And we keep everyone’s show on the road. There for our customers wherever and whenever they need us, we’re always ready for anything. That’s why, for over 100 years, we’ve continued to evolve and adapt. Today, as the nation’s number one motoring organisation, we offer a range of excellent products and services to millions of customers.
This is the job
Location: Northampton
Salary: £27,865.80 OTE £30,000
An exciting opportunity has arisen to join The AA as we embark on a journey into building our own network of garages. This will allow us to ensure the best journey to our customers by providing them with The AA expertise its built its reputation on, from start to finish!
We are looking for Repair Centre Technicians to help us realise this exciting new opportunity. The role is to provide quality, professional and effective repairs of vehicles. You will be working in a state-of-the-art workshop with all facilities on site. Tools and ongoing training provided including Hybrid L3.
What will I be doing?
Undertake all aspects of servicing & repair including diagnostics, clutch swaps, gearbox replacements turbo replacement, minor engine repairs
Providing vehicle mechanical reports to business customers/organisations
Greeting the customer and talking through the requirements of the repair service
Creating videos for feedback and authority from customers
Ordering parts and liaising with parts suppliers
You will be the face of the AA at the AA Repair Centre
Promoting the company and its services by projecting an efficient and professional image at all times
Ensuring the optimum use of time and costs when undertaking diagnostic work
Maintaining a high level of knowledge in the field of automotive systems
What do I need?
Capability, Knowledge and Experience:
Workshop experience gained from either an independent or franchised automotive
Education and Qualifications:

ROLE SUMMARY

The job role offers the successful candidate a role in our southern based geo-environmental team predominantly operating within the London and Home Counties regions. We undertake a wide range of projects relating to ground conditions from environmental, geotechnical, monitoring perspectives (or combinations thereof). Necessarily, the role therefore requires regular travel to Sites and a high proportion of driving and working outside. The role is physical and requires good mobility and fitness. Following suitable training, while there is a tight team spirit and remote support available, the role will often involve a degree of autonomy on Site and the candidate will need to be comfortable in both working in teams as well as individually. A practical mind with good problem solving/ solution based outlooks are key to enjoying and feeling fulfilled in this role. Working considerately and with a high regard to health and safety are paramount.

Typical duties for this technician role will include routine ground gas and groundwater monitoring and sampling, supervision of ground investigations, soil logging, sampling and verification works. The role will include organisational duties such as those required to organise plant and resources (e.g. consumables for monitoring and sampling) or on occasion, to arrange small investigation projects (e.g. BRE365 tests).

If this role sounds of interest to you, please do continue to read the below additional personal, technical and company aspirational values to see what you think you could bring to our growing team. If you feel this would be a match for you; wed love to hear from you with a view to discussing the opportunity further and what a career in Delta-Simons can offer you.
GRADE SUMMARY
Work as a Technician within a Team/Business Unit.
Responsible, where delegated authority has been made, for undertaking site survey, site monitoring and assessment, data assessment and reporting.

QUALIFICATIONS

GCSE in five subjects Grade C and above (to include English, Maths and at least one Science)
Demonstration of equivalent qualification or experience.

EXPERIENCE & SKILLS

A developing knowledge of relevant legislation, standards and guidance relevant to discipline.
A developing knowledge of field/ site assessment work, laboratory testing methods and scheduling (where necessary), assessing and interpretation of results and findings of field work
Sound communication and personal effectiveness skills.
Developing ability to build and maintain effective working relationships at all levels.
Full Driving Licence.

To work within and be a champion for, the company health, safety and environmental policy.
Personal effectiveness

Demonstrate willingness and take a proactive approach to ongoing CPD.
To effectively communicate and co-operate within a Team to support the achievement of a project brief through the provision of efficient and professional services.
To share both knowledge and experience with other team members.
Team working
To demonstrate ability to communicate effectively with work colleagues and third parties working on sites.
To develop and maintain good working relationships with work colleagues.
To participate fully in Company training and business improvement initiatives.
Project briefs, deadlines and resources

To demonstrate an understanding of task objectives, or highlight deficiencies in understanding/knowledge to manager, prior to commencement.
Where requested, to ensure all project resources, including suppliers, are in place prior to commencement of works.

Productivity

Miele Professional are recruiting service technicians to join the Field Service Team in East London.

We are looking for experienced technicians who will champion the highest standards of technical expertise in the field and ensure these standards are upheld and consistently delivered to our customers as an Ambassador for Miele.

About Miele:
Miele is a world leader in the production of premium domestic and commercial appliances. As current winners of the 2020 Which? Best Large Kitchen Appliance Brand, we take immense pride, not only in the quality of our appliances but all aspects of customer services.

Since being founded in 1899 Miele has followed its 'Forever Better' brand promise. This means: we will do all that we can to be "forever better" than our competitors and "forever better" than we already are. For our customers, this means the peace of mind of knowing that choosing Miele is a good decision - and probably the decision of a lifetime. For Miele, meeting the expectations of its customers when it comes to products and services – and even exceeding them where possible – is of the utmost importance.

Miele has a respectful, positive and inclusive culture and working for Miele GB is exciting and rewarding. We employ approximately 450 employees in all areas of our business and can provide a great foundation to progress your career within the organisation.

We are always looking for dynamic individuals who can share the passion we have for our products and who can contribute to our continued growth.

Overview:
Reporting to the Field Service Manager - Professional, the role will be responsible for service and repair of the complete range of Professional appliances installed in various commercial applications, companies & businesses. Some nationwide travel, occasional stays away from home and some out of hours work may be required. Therefore, flexibility is an essential requirement.

It is imperative successful applicants are high performing Technicians in the field, with role model behaviours. Acting as Brand and Technical Ambassador you will promote and maintain a premium customer experience at all times.

The Role:
Key deliverables in this role are:
Carry out Field Professional Service Technician duties as and when required in line with customer requirements and Service KPI demands including planned maintenance, fault diagnosis / repair and electrical safety testing.
Develop and maintain service plans for the product scope, explore new business, i.e. service contracts, planned maintenance schedules, etc.
To ensure all prepping of jobs, spares returns, vehicle maintenance, software downloads / updates and emails are undertaken on a daily basis.
Assist call planners and service partners in resolving problem calls quickly and efficiently, if and where appropriate.
To attend and satisfactorily complete designated company approved technical training courses (provided both internally and externally).

You will be required to attend training and / or meetings at head office in Abingdon, Oxfordshire that may require overnight stays.

The Person:
The successful candidate will have a very high level of general technical knowledge of Laundry appliances / applications and dishwashers. Experience in Professional appliances i.e. medical / laboratory washer disinfectors would be an advantage. A gas qualification is desirable together with solid IT skills.

We are also looking for someone who is self-motivated with excellent organisational and communication skills, demonstrates good practice and a good team player that will ensure our customers receive a premium level of service.

This is an amazing opportunity to work for a family owned company who value their employees and in return provide you with the best quality training, tools and equipment. We offer an on-going comprehensive training programme combined with a structured career path.

An apprenticeship with Miele is a great way to learn while you earn. Starting in March 2021 you will receive technical training, an experienced mentor, a recognised qualification at the end. Upon successful completion of the apprenticeship, you could be considers for a role with Miele as a Field Service Technician with the potential, over time, to earn up to £38,000 per annum. We provide you with a smart phone, travel expenses, lunch allowance, uniform and tools.

This is a full-time role. A driving licence needs to be attained during the Apprenticeship (this is not essential at apprenticeship level, but in order to be offered a permanent contract as a Field Service Technician you will need a full driving licence).

College Course:
This role provides an exciting opportunity to work towards and achieve a widely recognised qualification!

The successful candidates will be taught how to undertake activities, primarily by our in-house team but also through a 2-year course with Birmingham Metropolitan College (BMET College). There will be a requirement to attend the college for a total of 21 weeks across the duration of the course. Attendance will be in one-week blocks; therefore, you will be required at times to travel and stay within an easy commuting distance of the college in Birmingham. All travel, and accommodation required to attend college will be booked and paid for by Miele. As you progress with your training, you will be expected to complete activities on your own with support and guidance from in house colleagues as necessary. Upon successful completion of the college course an Electrical and Electronic Servicing Apprenticeship Level 3 qualification can be achieved.

Attending all internal and external training courses to develop new skills.

Meeting customer’s expectations of the Miele Brand by projecting a professional image and positive attitude towards the customer.
Gaining a thorough working knowledge of designated Miele appliances through completion of training modules.
Visiting customer premises with one of our experienced Field Service Technicians to fault diagnose and repair domestic appliances
Liaising closely with the Miele Line Manager, External Tutor and Miele Mentor to ensure smooth progression through the Apprenticeship Scheme.
Undertaking a range of tasks suited to the current level of training and development.
Attending and fully participating in regular training and development reviews with Line Manager and Tutor

Responsible for the maintenance, set-up and teardown of Carlsbad classrooms and the preparation and packaging of education materials and equipment for shipment by performing the following duties.

ESSENTIAL DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES
Properly execute classroom maintenance, teardowns, and set-ups.
Perform cleaning, maintenance, minor repairs and calibration of classroom equipment.
Participate in the ongoing update of the classroom maintenance schedules.
Proactively communicate to management and other departments of potential upcoming schedule conflicts or delays.
Replace failed equipment or materials per instructor/management request in a timely manner.
Coordinate with other GIA personnel and departments when sending equipment out for repair.
Provide timely communication to Inventory Coordinator on any classroom equipment that is moved to another location, is out-for-repair, or out-of-service.
Prepare and package student materials and equipment for domestic and international shipments for off-site delivery of Carlsbad lab classes and seminars.
Pick, assemble, pack and prepare education material orders for domestic and international shipment according to provided packing list and department specifications.
Document and update inventory tracking as materials are pulled.
Perform basic quality inspection to ensure materials and equipment meet standards prior to packing for shipment.
Ensure orders are accurate and stage items correctly for delivery.
Ensure warehouse area, inventory room and classrooms are arranged and organized in a logical manner.
Track consumable use and inventory for the Carlsbad campus to assure accurate department billing and budget; monitor and initiate action to replenish stock as needed.
Collaborate with Inventory Coordinator on any discrepancies based on inventory audits or reports.
Communicate effectively while under tight deadlines and provide excellent customer service to all departments.
Maintain familiarity and understanding of the department’s Hazardous Material ESHAT document.
Properly wear, use and maintain Personal Protective Equipment (PPE) including:
Select and properly wear PPE appropriate for a variety of job responsibilities at all times.
Care for, clean and maintain PPE, including notifying management if need to repair or replace PPE.
Attend training sessions on PPE as required.
Responsible for occasional use of power tools including but not limited to power lapidary saw, table saw and power drill.
Ensure proper PPE is worn at all times.
Follow instructions for equipment operation at all times.
Complete training for use of power tools, hazardous materials, chemicals, equipment, etc. Ensure training is up-to-date and completed in the required timeframe.
Other duties as assigned.
TECHNICAL COMPETENCIES (Knowledge, Skills & Abilities)
Good verbal and written communication skills.
Basic computer skills in Microsoft Office Suite applications.
Basic math skills.
Acute attention to detail and excellent organization skills.
Ability to deal effectively with a variety of personalities to establish and maintain effective working relationships.
Ability to interpret and apply written policies, procedures, and work instructions.
Ability to maintain and foster sensitivity and respect for a culturally diverse work environment.
EDUCATION AND EXPERIENCE
High school diploma or equivalent.
Experience working in a manufacturing environment, with machinery equipment, or warehouse maintenance preferred.
PHYSICAL REQUIREMENTS / WORK ENVIRONMENT (if applicable)
Extended periods of time standing, walking, and stooping. The employee is regularly required to stand; walk; use hands to finger, handle, or feel; reach with hands and arms; stoop, kneel, crouch, or crawl. The employee occasionally is required to climb or balance. The employee is occasionally required to sit. The employee must occasionally lift and/or move up to 50 pounds. Specific vision abilities required by this job include close vision, distance vision, peripheral vision, depth perception, and ability to adjust focus.
Use of power machinery. The employee is occasionally required to use power saws, drills, and other powered tools.
Work is performed in a warehouse and classroom environment. The employee is regularly working in the presence of fumes or airborne particles, toxic or caustic chemicals. The employee is occasionally working in the presence of various machines and moving mechanical parts including fork lift operations. The noise level in the work environment is usually moderate.
Limited use of office equipment to include computer, and other business related machines and software.

Job Details
Introduction
BARB (The Broadcasters' Audience Research Board) is responsible for the measurement of the number of people watching television in the UK, on behalf of the television companies and the advertising industry.
Viewing estimates are obtained from panels of television owning households representing the viewing behaviour of the 24+ million households within UK. The panels are regionally representative of ITV & BBC. In each panel home, electronic “Peoplemeters” are attached to each TV. Each meter automatically identifies and collects information about the programme and channel that the panel member is viewing. This information is collected via modem each night and is then used to derive the ratings data for the BARB subscribers. Ratings data are available the next day, 365 days a year.
Our Field Technicians are responsible for installing and maintaining the TV, PC and Tablet monitoring equipment and software in panel households.
Job Location: West Wales ( Swansea and surrounding areas)
Key Outcome:
The Kantar Media technician is our representative in panel homes and is therefore expected to be professional, courteous and presentable at all times. The technician is also responsible for ensuring the accuracy of the data from the metering equipment and software in panel homes to:
Install and maintain metering equipment and software in panel homes.
Educate panel members in the correct use and care of the metering equipment.
Remove television monitoring equipment from homes that wish to leave the panel.
Educate panel members in the correct use of Kantar monitoring software.
Remove monitoring software from homes that wish to leave the panel
Store monitoring equipment in safe conditions when not installed in panel homes.
Resolve or escalate any problems caused by monitoring equipment or software in panel homes.
Liaise between Kantar management, office staff & panel members as necessary.
Report all field technician activity, including appointments, visits made, mileage etc.
Timely return all faulty meter equipment, clearly labelled.
Maintain the company vehicle in a roadworthy, clean condition.
Ensure SLA’s (Service Level Agreements) are satisfied within specific timeframes. Kantar meters make a number of measurements at the TV. The audio and video outputs from the TV are sampled, and also the audio from peripheral devices. In digital satellite homes, the STB will be probed to extract detailed channel data.
Candidate Specification
Core Skills The ideal candidate would have a wide ranging technical skill set based around installation and faultfinding of domestic networking ,software and AV equipment. We would also consider a background in commercial installation and support of video conferencing and multi-room installations.
1. Technical ability to install & service the TV metering equipment. The meters are non-invasive, meaning that it isn’t necessary to open TV sets and other devices. A thorough understanding of A/V routing (Scart, RGB, Composite video, HDMI etc) in domestic environments is essential.
2. Knowledge of home networking, routers,, Windows PC`s and Apple Macs/ Excel / Word and Hardware / software configurations and installations.
3. The ability to work without direct supervision to a high standard. The field technician will be responsible for arranging some appointments with panel members for service calls to designated households, and these must be done in a timely manner.
4. Exemplary customer care skills. The field technician is the representative of Kantar in the panel members’ homes. Meters are installed only with the permission of the panel members, and it is therefore essential that the field technician remains professional, prompt & courteous in all dealings with panel members.
We will be looking for evidence of the following during the application and selection process for this roles:
Demonstrable experience of A/V systems/installation in domestic environments.
Detailed knowledge of TV and peripheral technology, supplemented possibly with a qualification in electronics, audio, video or television servicing.
Ability to work unsupervised and remotely, making work schedules as required.
Excellent interpersonal skills.
Advanced keyboard skills with the ability to instal bespoke software on Pc’s, Macs, iOS and Android
Basic understanding of home networking broadband and routers
Prepared to drive within the UK mainland and associated Islands.
This may require overnight stays, therefore, flexibility to work away from home.
A full driving licence (a company vehicle is provided).
C.R.B check documentation.

Job Title: Specialist Technician (Learning and Teaching): 3D Milling and Cutting
Job Description:
In this key role, you will provide professional expertise, guidance and advice and contribute to the delivery of teaching and learning activities within the College. The position is to cover and supervise the digital fabrication resource at Golden Lane site which includes Laser cutter and CNC routers and knowledge of Adobe Illustrator and Rhino 3D modelling software. They will also be required to facilitate and support student making using both hand and machine techniques and be confident in the use of traditional workshop equipment, along with other workshop disciplines as required.

You will also be responsible for ensuring the learning environment is adequately equipped, whilst supporting and supervising a diverse range of learners in using various equipment.

You will provide support for student learning, informal and formal training and instruction and the development of proficiency with highly specialised techniques.

If you have any queries you may contact the LCF Staffing Team, email: vacancies@fashion.arts.ac.uk.
Why choose us?
University of the Arts London is a vibrant world centre for innovation, drawing together six Colleges with international reputations in art, design, fashion, communication and performing arts.
London College of Fashion is extremely proud to be a global leader in fashion education, research and consultancy. Much of its success is down to its dedicated employees, and you will play an important role in shaping future creative professionals, and impact on the future of so many creative industries.
London College of Fashion, UAL is undertaking an unprecedented programme of change. In 2023 we will be consolidating our existing six sites into a new purpose built campus as part of a new education and cultural district on the Queen Elizabeth Olympic Park. Ahead of this move, we welcome applications from candidates who live in and around East London, as well as from those keen to join us on this exciting and unique opportunity in our College’s history.
Your profile
Ideally with a degree or an equivalent qualification and industry experience and ideally candidates should possess a degree level qualification.
A motivated, creative individual with high levels of technical competence and a dedication to technological development.
With good communication skills, you will be able to contribute crucial input to student concept and expressive/ creative intention, including giving feedback to students and helping with student formative assessments, with reference to appropriate learning outcomes of the course or project. The post holder should be proactive, well organised, command excellent interpersonal and supervisory skills in addition to a strong sense of teamwork and collaboration
UAL is committed to creating a diverse and inclusive university - a place where we all can be ourselves and reach our full potential in our work, learning and creative practice. We offer a range of family friendly, inclusive employment policies, flexible working arrangements and Staff Support Networks. We welcome applicants from diverse backgrounds, including race, disability, age, sex, gender identity, sexual orientation, religion and belief, marriage and civil partnership, pregnancy and maternity, and caring responsibility.
Candidates are advised to submit applications early.
